## Article Ten: Entry into Force, Amendment, Termination
1. This Memorandum of Understanding shall enter into force on the date of receipt of the last notification by which one Party informs the other Party, in writing and through diplomatic channels, of the completion of its necessary national procedures for its entry into force.
2. This Memorandum shall remain in effect for a period of (5) years and shall be automatically renewed for another similar period or periods, unless one of the contracting Parties notifies the other contracting Party in writing of its desire to terminate it at least (6) months prior to the date of its termination or expiration through diplomatic channels.
3. The termination of this Memorandum of Understanding shall not affect the activities and projects signed and established under this agreement.

Done in Kuwait City on November 3, 2024, in two original copies in the Arabic, Tajik, and English languages, all texts being equally authentic. In case of divergence in interpretation, the English text shall prevail.

For
The Government of the State of Kuwait
Khalifa Abdullah Dhahi Al-Ajil Al-Askar <orig>خليفة عبد الله ضاحي العجيل العسكر</orig>
Minister of Commerce and Industry

For
The Government of the Republic of Tajikistan
Sirojiddin Muhriddin <orig>سراج الدين مهر الدين</orig>
Minister of Foreign Affairs

2. Exchange of information, including publications, periodicals, studies, statistics, and technical requirements in fields related to standardization, quality, inspection testing, and conformity assessment activities.
3. Exchange of information regarding integrated management systems and internationally accredited certificates in the field of standardization and laboratories in accordance with international specifications to benefit from each country's experience in this field.
4. Exchange of information on new proposed legislation or proposed amendments at an early stage of their preparation.
5. Spreading awareness in the fields of standardization, quality, inspection testing, and conformity assessment.
6. Coordination between the two Parties in the areas of work of international and regional organizations.

## Article Four: Application
The implementation of this Memorandum shall be carried out between the two Parties through executive work programs to be adopted and agreed upon by both Parties.

## Article Five: Coordination and Follow-up
1. Meetings shall be held between the two Parties periodically at the request of either Party to follow up and evaluate what has been accomplished.
2. Contact points for both Parties shall be designated.

## Article Six: Confidentiality
1. Each Party agrees to treat as confidential all documents declared by the other Party as confidential, which may include information and data obtained during the implementation of the present Memorandum of Understanding.
2. Neither Party may use other non-confidential documents obtained during the implementation period of this Memorandum except with the consent of the Party providing the documents.

## Article Seven: Dispute Resolution
Any dispute that may arise concerning the interpretation or implementation of this Memorandum shall be settled amicably between the Parties or through consultations and negotiations via diplomatic channels.

## Article Eight: General Provisions
The provisions of this Memorandum shall not prejudice the laws in force in either country or the rights or obligations of either state arising from international treaties and agreements to which either of them is a party.

## Article Nine: Amendments to the Memorandum
1. This Memorandum of Understanding may be amended and supplemented by mutual agreement between its two Parties, which shall be prepared by separate protocols.
2. The protocols shall be an integral part of this Memorandum of Understanding and shall enter into force in accordance with the provisions of Article 10 of this Memorandum of Understanding.

In desire of the two parties to strengthen their cooperation relations in the field of standardization and quality activities, laboratories, conformity assessment,'

Seeking confirmation of industrial products quality (excluding food products) imported and exported and eliminating technical barriers to trade and to protect consumer safety between the two countries, To avoid duplication of conformity assessments across boarders in accordance with the international requirements,

Have agreed as follows:

# Article 1
## Scope of Cooperation
Establishing technical and scientific cooperation that will achieve integration in the field of standardization, test results and conformity assessment in the best interest of the Parties.

# Article 2
## Areas of Cooperation
The cooperation between the Parties involves the areas of mutual work which involves:

1. Standardization:
   a. Studying the possibility of adopting standards and specifications in both countries, whose references are international, European, Regional or Arabic, which do not conflict with the legislation of both countries.
   b. Considering the standard specifications issued by the parties which has international reference i.e ISO standard as a main reference when preparing specifications in both countries.
   c. The Parties shall specify the standards and technical regulations related to the most exchanged goods between the two countries, specifying their reference and taking into consideration the following:
      - For goods that have unified standards and technical regulations in both countries, the unified standards, and regulations between the two countries shall be considered.
      - For goods that have different standards and technical regulations in both countries, the standards and regulations adopted by the importing country shall be considered.
   d. Studying the possibility of approaching comparable specifications of the products and the goods that are relative to the trade between the two countries in accordance with the international standards (Excluding food products)

2. Conformity Assessment:
   a. Studying the possibility of the mutual recognition of conformity assessment certificates issued by the two parties, according to the evidence and documents of specialized international organizations and in accordance with a mechanism agreed upon between the Parties.
   b. Studying the mutual recognition of the results of examination and tests issued by both Parties in accordance with the evidence and documentation, as well as the recognition of the laboratories tests and their results conducted by accredited laboratories by both Parties.

3. laboratories:
   a. Participation in proficiency testing programs (PTP) and inter laboratory comparison (ILC) for testing.
   b. Preparation of programs and studies on laboratories and test methods in accordance with the requirements of international standards.

# Article 3
## Channels of Cooperation
Cooperation between the Parties is carried out according to the following:

1. Exchange of experts and trainees, participating in training courses, seminars, conferences, and meetings related to the' topics of this memorandum that is held in any of the two countries.
2. Exchange of information including, articles, publications, studies, statistics and technical requirements in the fields of standardization, quality, test results and conformity assessment.
3. Exchange of information related to integrated management systems and international accredited certification in the field of standardization, and laboratories in both

## Article 4
### Implementation
The implementation of this memorandum shall be executed by the Parties under certain work programs that are approved and agreed between the Parties.

## Article 5

## Article 6
### Confidentiality
1. Each Party agrees to treat as confidential all documents that are stated as confidential by the other Party, which may include information and data obtained in the course of execution of this MOU.
2. Other non-confidential documents obtained during the engagement between parties can be used freely only after receiving consent from the providing Party.

## Article 7
### Settlement of Disputes
Any dispute that might arise from the application or interpretation of this MOU shall be settled amicably through diplomatic channels or by consultation and negotiations.

## Article 8
### General Provisions
The provisions of this MOU shall not prejudice the laws in force in either of the contracted Parties toward their rights or obligations arising from their international contracts or memorandums previously committed to any of the Contracted Parties.

## Article 9
### Amendments of the Memorandum
1. By mutual consent of the Parties, this MOU may be amended and supplemented, which are made out by separate protocols.
2. The protocols are considered integrative part of this MOU and enters into force in accordance with the provisions of article 10 of this MOU.

## Article 10
### Validity and Entry into Force

# Memorandum of Understanding on Cooperation in the Field of Standardization Activities between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the State of Qatar

The Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> "Standards and Metrology Department" (KOWSMD), and the Government of the State of Qatar, represented by the Qatar General Organization for Standardization and Metrology <orig>الهيئة العامة القطرية للمواصفات والتقييس</orig> (QS), hereinafter referred to as "the two Parties".
Desiring to strengthen their cooperative relations in the field of standardization, quality, laboratories, and conformity assessment activities;
Contributing to raising the quality of products (excluding food products) and services exchanged between the two countries, and ensuring the preservation of public health and environmental protection;
And to avoid the duplication of cross-border conformity assessment procedures in accordance with relevant international requirements, as well as in accordance with the laws, regulations, and instructions in force in both countries;
Have agreed as follows:

## Article One: Scope of Cooperation
The two Parties have agreed to establish technical and scientific cooperation between them that would achieve integration in the fields of standardization and conformity assessment in a manner that serves the interests of both countries.

## Article Two: Areas of Cooperation
### 1- Standardization:
a. The two Parties shall cooperate in the preparation and publication of standard specifications, technical regulations, and related publications.
b. The two Parties shall exchange information related to standard specifications, technical regulations, and related publications, as required by the cooperation, in order to facilitate commercial activities and eliminate technical barriers between the two Parties' countries.
c. The two Parties shall encourage the coordination of their positions in relevant international and regional organizations, including, for example, the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and the Standards and Metrology Institute for Islamic Countries (SMIIC).

### 2- Conformity Assessment:
a- The two Parties shall exchange information related to each other's product certificates, conformity assessment systems and procedures, as well as import and export requirements within the scope of their activities.
b- To study the mutual recognition of conformity assessment certificates and quality marks issued by both Parties in accordance with the guides and documents of specialized international organizations and under a mechanism to be agreed upon between the two Parties.
c- To study the mutual recognition of inspection and testing results issued by both Parties in accordance with the guides and documents of international organizations, as well as the recognition of inspection and testing results from laboratories accredited by both Parties.

### 3- Other Areas:
The two Parties shall consider other relevant areas and activities that would enhance cooperation and coordination within the framework of this Memorandum.

## Article Three: Forms of Cooperation
Cooperation between the two Parties shall take place in the following forms:
1) Exchanging experts and trainees and participating in training courses, seminars, conferences, and meetings related to the activities stipulated in this Memorandum, held in either country.
2) Exchanging information, including bulletins, periodicals, studies, statistics, and technical requirements in fields related to standardization and conformity assessment activities.
3) Exchanging information regarding management system certificates and accredited international certificates in the field of standardization and laboratories, in accordance with international standards, to benefit from each country's experience in this field.
4) Exchanging information on new proposed legislation or proposed amendments at an early stage of their preparation.
5) Spreading awareness in the fields of standardization and conformity assessment.
6) Coordinating between them in the areas of work of relevant international and regional organizations.

# Decree No. 134 of 2025 Approving the Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the United Arab Emirates regarding Cooperation in the Field of Standardization Activities

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And upon the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following

## Article One
The Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the (Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>), and the Government of the United Arab Emirates, represented by the (Ministry of Industry and Advanced Technology <orig>وزارة الصناعة والتكنولوجيا المتقدمة</orig>), regarding Cooperation in the Field of Standardization Activities, signed on 2/9/2024, the text of which is attached to this Decree, is hereby approved.

## Article Two
The Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

### Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

### Prime Minister
Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

### Minister of Foreign Affairs
Abdullah Ali Abdullah Al-Yahya <orig>عبد الله علي عبد الله اليحيا</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace on: 25 Muharram 1447 H
Corresponding to: 20 July 2025 AD

## Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the United Arab Emirates regarding Cooperation in the Field of Standardization Activities

The Government of the State of Kuwait, represented by the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, and the Government of the United Arab Emirates, represented by the Ministry of Industry and Advanced Technology <orig>وزارة الصناعة والتكنولوجيا المتقدمة</orig>, hereinafter referred to as "the Parties".
Desiring to strengthen the cooperative relations between them in the fields of standardization, quality, laboratories, and conformity assessment activities, and seeking to ensure the quality of imported and exported non-food industrial goods and products, reduce technical barriers to trade, and protect consumer safety in both countries.

## Article Four: Application
This Memorandum shall be implemented between the Parties through executive work programs to be established and approved by both Parties.

## Article Five: Coordination and Follow-up
Meetings shall be held between the Parties periodically, alternating between the two countries, when necessary or at the request of either Party, to follow up on and evaluate the progress made within the framework of this Memorandum.

## Article Six: Confidentiality
Each Party agrees to treat as confidential all documents declared by the other Party as confidential, which may include information and data obtained during the implementation of this Memorandum.
Neither Party may use other non-confidential documents obtained during the implementation period of this Memorandum except with the prior and explicit written consent of the Party providing such documents.

## Article Seven: Settlement of Disagreements or Disputes
Any disagreement or dispute that may arise concerning the interpretation or implementation of this Memorandum shall be settled amicably between the Parties through consultations and negotiations, via diplomatic channels.

## Article Eight: Entry into Force, Duration, and Termination
This Memorandum shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last notification by which either Party informs the other in writing, through diplomatic channels, of the completion of the necessary constitutional requirements for the entry into force of this Memorandum in both countries.
This Memorandum may be amended in writing with the consent of both Parties at any time, and such amendment shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures set forth in the first paragraph of this Article.
This Memorandum shall remain in effect for a period of (5) five years and shall be automatically renewed for a similar period or periods, unless one Party notifies the other in writing of its desire to terminate it, at least (6) six months prior to its termination or expiration date, through diplomatic channels.
The termination or expiration of this Memorandum shall not affect the activities and projects currently underway until their completion, unless the Parties agree otherwise in writing.

## Article Nine: General Provisions
The provisions of this Memorandum shall not prejudice the laws in force in either country or the rights or obligations of either State arising from international treaties and agreements to which either is a party.
In witness whereof, the undersigned plenipotentiaries, being duly authorized by their respective governments, have signed this Memorandum.
This Memorandum was drawn up and signed in the city of Doha, on 4 Sha'ban 1446 Hijri, corresponding to 3 February 2025 Gregorian, in two original copies in the Arabic language, both having the same full legal force.

The two parties have agreed to the following:

## Article One
### Scope of Cooperation
To establish technical and scientific cooperation that achieves integration in the fields of standardization and conformity assessment in a manner that serves the interests of both parties.

## Article Two
### Areas of Cooperation
Cooperation between the two parties shall include their common areas of work with respect to:
1) Standardization:
    a. Studying the possibility of adopting the standard specifications in force in both countries, whose references are international, European, regional, or Arab specifications that do not conflict with the legislation of the two countries.
    b. The two parties shall identify the specifications and technical regulations related to the most traded goods between the two countries, specifying their reference and taking into account the following:
        1. Adopting unified specifications and regulations between the two countries in light of the technical legislation of both countries.
        2. Adopting the specifications or technical regulations approved in the importing country if the specifications are not unified, in light of the technical legislation of both countries.
        3. Studying the possibility of harmonizing the specifications of products and goods traded between the two countries with international specifications (with the exception of food products).
2) Conformity Assessment:
Cooperation in the field of product conformity assessment and harmonization of standards for conformity assessment activities towards mutual recognition of: conformity assessment results, conformity assessment models and quality marks, and conformity certificates and marks according to the sectors of interest to both countries.
3) Laboratories: Studying the mutual recognition of inspection and testing results issued by laboratories accredited by both parties, where applicable to the second party.

## Article Three
### Channels of Cooperation
Cooperation between the two parties shall be carried out as follows:
1) Exchanging experts and trainees and participating in training courses, seminars, conferences, and meetings related to the activities under this memorandum, which are held in either country.
2) Exchanging information, including bulletins, periodicals, studies, statistics, and technical requirements in the fields related to standardization and conformity assessment activities.
3) Exchanging information regarding integrated management systems and accredited international certificates in the field of standardization and laboratories in accordance with international specifications, to benefit from each country's experience in this field.
4) Exchanging information on documents in the field of specifications, including the organizational structure for specifications, the rules and procedures necessary for preparing standard specifications and their guides, and the specifications and action plans for preparing specifications.
5) Spreading awareness in the fields of standardization and conformity assessment.
6) Coordination between the two parties in the areas of work of international and regional organizations.

## Article Four
### Application
The implementation of this memorandum between the two parties shall be by virtue of executive work programs to be decided upon and agreed to between them.

## Article Five
### Coordination and Follow-up
1) Meetings shall be held between the two parties periodically at the request of either party to follow up on and evaluate what has been accomplished.
2) Contact points for both parties shall be identified.

## Article Six
### Confidentiality
1) Each party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of all documents declared by the disclosing party as confidential, which may include information and data obtained during the implementation of this memorandum.
2) Neither party may use other non-confidential documents obtained during the implementation period of this memorandum except with the written consent of the party providing the documents, through diplomatic channels.

## Article Seven
### Intellectual Property Rights
The two parties shall provide appropriate means to protect the intellectual property rights arising from the implementation of this memorandum, taking into account the laws, regulations, rules, and bilateral or multilateral agreements to which either party is a party.

# Council of Ministers
## Council of Ministers Decision
## No. 906 of 2025
### Regarding the Revocation of Kuwaiti Nationality Certificates from Certain Individuals

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,

**It is decided**

### Article One
The Kuwaiti nationality certificates shall be revoked from the individuals listed below, and the Kuwaiti nationality shall be revoked from any person who may have acquired it by dependency from the holder of said certificate:
1- Nayef Shabib Mohammed Daghash Afnis Al-Ajmi <orig>نايف شبيب محمد دغش افنيس العجمي</orig>.
2- Abdulrahman Shabib Mohammed Daghash Afnis Al-Ajmi <orig>عبد الرحمن شبيب محمد دغش افنيس العجمي</orig>.
3- Mubarak Shabib Mohammed Daghash Afnis Al-Ajmi <orig>مبارك شبيب محمد دغش افنيس العجمي</orig>.
4- Ghanem Meshal Aswad Salama Al-Anzi <orig>غانم مشعل اسود سلامة العنزي</orig>.
5- Thunayan Farraj Munawer Zabil Al-Shammari <orig>ثنيان فراج مناور زبيل الشمري</orig>.
6- Kanaan Farraj Munawer Zabil Al-Shammari <orig>كنعان فراج مناور زبيل الشمري</orig>.
7- Sharaf Mahdi Rashid Hadi Al-Ajmi <orig>شرف مهدي راشد هادي العجمي</orig>.
8- Khairallah Mohammed Hadid Saad Aradah <orig>خير الله محمد حديد سعد عراده</orig>.
9- Ajeel Mohammed Hadid Aradah <orig>عجيل محمد حديد عراده</orig>.
10- Saeed Manea Qailan Hadi Saeed Khader Al-Ajmi <orig>سعيد مانع قيلان هادي سعيد خضر العجمي</orig>.

### Article Two
The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior shall implement this decision. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Prime Minister**
**Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>**

Issued on: 28 Muharram 1447 H
Corresponding to: 23 July 2025 AD

---

### Article Eight
#### General Provisions
The provisions of this Memorandum shall not prejudice the laws in force in either country or the rights or obligations of either State arising from international treaties and agreements to which either of them is a party.

### Article Nine
#### Dispute Settlement
Any dispute that may arise concerning the interpretation or implementation of this Memorandum shall be settled amicably between the two parties or through consultations and negotiations via diplomatic channels.

### Article Ten
#### Validity and Entry into Force
1) This Memorandum shall enter into force on the date of receipt of the last notification by which either party informs the other contracting party in writing, through diplomatic channels, of the fulfillment of the constitutional requirements necessary for the entry into force of this Memorandum.
2) This Memorandum of Understanding may be amended in writing with the consent of both parties at any time, and the amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures set forth in the first paragraph of this Article.
3) This Memorandum shall remain in effect for a period of (5) years and shall be automatically renewed for another similar period or periods, unless one party notifies the other party in writing of its desire to terminate it at least (6) months prior to the date of its termination or expiration, through diplomatic channels.
4) The termination of this Memorandum of Understanding shall not affect the activities and projects that have been signed and are being implemented at the time of its termination.

Done in the city of Abu Dhabi on Monday, corresponding to 2 September 2024, in two original copies in the Arabic language, both having equal legal validity.

For
The Government of the State of Kuwait

## Decision
On Thursday, 3/7/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
With the membership of Mr. Imran Muhammad Al-Kandari <orig>عمران محمد الكندري</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. Yousef Al-Bakr <orig>يوسف البكر</orig>, Secretary <orig>أمين السر</orig>
In the application / case No. 3/2024 Preventive Settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>
Registered under automated No.: 244194230
Submitted by Banta Furniture and Furnishings Company L.L.C. <orig>شركة بنتا للأثاث والمفروشات ذ.م.م</orig>
Against
1- Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>
2- Ahli United Bank <orig>البنك الأهلي المتحد</orig> - currently Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>
3- Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig>
4- Al Mulla Finance Company <orig>شركة الملا للتمويل</orig>
5- Industrial Bank <orig>البنك الصناعي</orig>
6- And others

After reviewing the application documents:
The summary of the facts is that the applicant / Banta Furniture and Furnishings Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة بنتا للأثاث والمفروشات (ذ.م.م)</orig> submitted an application to the Bankruptcy Administration in its capacity as a (debtor <orig>مدين</orig>) for a preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig> against 1- Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>, 2- Ahli United Bank <orig>البنك الأهلي المتحد</orig> - currently Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>, 3- Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig>, 4- Al Mulla Finance Company <orig>شركة الملا للتمويل</orig>, 5- Industrial Bank <orig>البنك الصناعي</orig>, and others.

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be considered executive instruments <orig>سندات تنفيذية</orig> under this law. The Bankruptcy Administration shall affix the writ of execution <orig>الصيغة التنفيذية</orig> to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

Furthermore, the applicant company's business is capable of continuing, as its knowledge is based on a technical study by the Crowe Kuwait Consulting office <orig>مكتب كرو كويت للاستشارات</orig>, which is registered with the regulatory authorities. The debtor applicant has a plan to resume its activities and has future cash flows. The creditors are holders of ordinary debts. The total bank debts amount to two million, five hundred eighty-nine thousand and forty-one dinars <orig>دينار</orig>; the total supplier debts amount to one million, eight hundred forty-three thousand and eleven dinars <orig>دينار</orig>; and the total employee debts amount to one million, four hundred thirty-four thousand, three hundred and sixteen dinars <orig>دينار</orig>. There are also debts to other parties amounting to one million, six hundred thirty-eight thousand and seven dinars <orig>دينار</orig>. The book value of fixed assets is 650,357 dinars <orig>دينار</orig>. There are methods to amortize the accumulated losses, and there is a financial study with a preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig> plan. Evidence and documents were submitted demonstrating its ability to continue operations and amortize its losses in a short period. Document portfolios were submitted, the most important of which included a decision from an extraordinary general assembly <orig>جمعية عمومية غير عادية</orig>, a letter classifying creditors, amounts due, and guarantees provided, a copy of the list of goods and assets, and financial statements for banks, suppliers, and employees). Consequently, the company became unable to pay its debts as a result of this impediment.

At the session of 26/12/2024, the applicant company's lawyer submitted a defense memorandum and a portfolio of documents demonstrating its ability to continue operations and repay creditors' debts in light of the preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig> plan it submitted. The applicant company had outlined in its application a summary of the proposed preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig> and the agreements to be concluded with creditors regarding the settlement. It stated its desire to be granted sufficient time to settle the debts outstanding against it, in order to preserve the company's entity, the value of its assets, and the interests of its shareholders, while affirming its ability to fulfill all these debts.

At the session of 26/12/2024, a decision was issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي افلاس</orig> (to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> to examine the application and provide an opinion thereon, indicating the feasibility of the preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>, assessing the debtor's financial situation and the debts outstanding against it, stating whether or not precautionary measures should be taken, stating whether or not the debtor is capable of managing its business and funds on its own, and providing us with a detailed report on the matter, while working as much as possible to accomplish this within the legal deadlines prescribed for doing so under the Bankruptcy Law, and indicating the need to appoint an observer <orig>مراقب</orig> to examine the proposed preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>, the measures taken, and the implementation of its proposal, and in the affirmative case, stating the value of the financial amount due to the observer <orig>مراقب</orig>, whether on a monthly or annual basis).

Whereas a letter was received from the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة افلاس</orig> dated 20/3/2025, stating that it is unable to provide an opinion due to deficiencies in some details, and refers to them in detail to avoid repetition.

Whereas the applicant's lawyer submitted three document portfolios, a flash memory drive, and a defense memorandum in response to the report of the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة افلاس</orig> and insisted on his requests.

At the session of 14/4/2025, a decision was issued (to re-address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> in light of the final defense memorandum submitted by the applicant, its document portfolios, and the attached flash memory drive, in response to the letter from the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة افلاس</orig> dated [date missing], in order to "examine the application and provide an opinion thereon, indicating the feasibility of the preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>, assessing the debtor's financial situation and the debts outstanding against it, stating whether or not precautionary measures should be taken, stating whether or not the debtor is capable of managing its business and funds on its own, and providing us with a detailed report on the matter, while working as much as possible to accomplish this within the legal deadlines prescribed for doing so under the Bankruptcy Law, and indicating the need to appoint an observer <orig>مراقب</orig> to examine the proposed preventive settlement <orig>تسوية وقائية</orig>, the measures taken, and the implementation of its proposal).

On 12/6/2025, a decision was issued to commence preventive settlement procedures, stay all claims, prepare a preventive settlement proposal by the applicant, and form a creditors' committee. The decision is referred to in detail. Regarding the appointment of a controller for the preventive settlement request, Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 stipulates (Controller: The person who follows up on the implementation of preventive settlement, restructuring, and bankruptcy declaration procedures through the information received from the debtor, the trustee, and the creditors).
Article (12, paragraph 3) of the Bankruptcy Law stipulates (The Bankruptcy Committee is responsible for: 3- Establishing a schedule of fees for trustees, controllers, and inspectors appointed in accordance with the provisions of this law, and any costs they incur due to preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy procedures, and presenting it to the Minister for approval).
Whereas, based on the foregoing and guided by it, the applicant company, in the session of 19/12/2024, agreed to the appointment of Ms. Rabia Saad Al-Muhanna <orig>رابعة سعد المهنا</orig> as a bankruptcy trustee. Likewise, in the same session, the aforementioned Ms. agreed to her appointment as a controller or bankruptcy trustee to examine this request. Furthermore, the Bankruptcy Committee, in its last letter dated 12/6/2025, concluded in its fifth clause (There is a need to appoint a controller to follow up on the preventive settlement procedures and supervise the company's financial affairs, and the proposed monthly fee is one thousand dinars per month). Based on the above, a decision is issued by the bankruptcy judge to appoint Ms. Rabia Saad Al-Muhanna <orig>رابعة سعد المهنا</orig> as a controller for Penta Furniture and Furnishings Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة بنتا للأثاث والمفروشات ذ.م.م</orig> to follow up on the preventive settlement procedures and supervise the company's financial affairs for a monthly salary of one thousand dinars, in accordance with the conclusion of the Bankruptcy Committee's report. This is to be calculated from 12/6/2025, the date the decision was issued to commence preventive settlement procedures, stay all claims, and prepare the preventive settlement proposal, until the date a final decision is issued on this request, its publication in the Official Gazette, and the notification of the parties in this regard, as will be stated in the operative part.
Therefore
The bankruptcy judge has decided: To appoint Ms. Rabia Saad Al-Muhanna <orig>رابعة سعد المهنا</orig> as a "controller" for Penta Furniture and Furnishings Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة بنتا للأثاث والمفروشات ذ.م.م</orig> to follow up on the request for preventive settlement procedures and supervise the company's financial affairs. She is entitled to a monthly salary of KWD 1,000 (one thousand dinars) in accordance with the conclusion of the Bankruptcy Committee's report dated 12/6/2025, starting from today's date, 3/7/2025, until the final decision on this request is issued. This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette, and the Court Clerk's Office shall notify the parties in this regard.
Bankruptcy Judge
Court Clerk

### Decision
On Thursday, 17/7/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department
With the membership of Mr. Abdullah Al-Tabtabaie <orig>عبد الله الطبطبائي</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge
And in the presence of Mr. Othman Al-Siddi <orig>عثمان الصدي</orig>, Court Clerk
In Request No: (2024/187 Bankruptcy Declaration)

And registered in Case No. 2005/188 Public Debts Bankruptcy on 14/2/2006
Submitted by: The Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> in its capacity as the bankruptcy administrator for the bankrupt Ahmed Abdulrahman Ibrahim Al-Biji <orig>احمد عبد الرحمن إبراهيم البيجي</orig>
Against: The bankrupt / Ahmed Abdulrahman Ibrahim Al-Biji <orig>احمد عبد الرحمن إبراهيم البيجي</orig>
Whereas the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> submitted letter No. M.A.S / 21/10–799, which includes a request to close the bankruptcy proceedings for the bankrupt Ahmed Abdulrahman Ibrahim Al-Biji <orig>احمد عبد الرحمن إبراهيم البيجي</orig> due to the lack of funds belonging to the bankruptcy estate, in accordance with Article 196 of Law No. 71 of 2020.
Consequently, it is established by the text of Article 196 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of (If the bankruptcy proceedings are stayed for insufficiency of funds before the ratification of the judicial composition, the bankruptcy judge may decide to close them. The decision to close the bankruptcy for insufficiency of funds results in the return to each creditor of the right to take individual actions and file individual lawsuits. If the creditor's debt has been verified and accepted in the bankruptcy, they may enforce it against the debtor in accordance with the provisions of Article (195) of this law.
The bankruptcy trustee shall be responsible for a period of one year from the date of the decision to close the bankruptcy for the documents delivered to them by the creditors.)
Article 197 stipulates (The bankrupt and any interested party may request the bankruptcy judge to reverse the decision to close the bankruptcy if it is proven that there are sufficient funds to cover the expenses of the bankruptcy proceedings, or if a sufficient amount is delivered to the trustee for that purpose.)

It is also established, pursuant to the text of Article 21 of Law No. 41 of 1993 regarding the State's purchase of certain debts and the method of their collection, that (if the bankruptcy is closed due to the insufficiency of its funds, or if temporary distributions are made, or if sums are obtained as a result of a judicial composition or a composition with abandonment of assets, and upon the termination of the bankruptcy and in all cases where temporary or final distributions are made in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Code, the Director shall receive these funds and distribute them to the creditors according to their share in the bankruptcy, without prejudice to their rights stipulated in Articles (666) and (732) of the Commercial Code, taking into account what is stated in Article (12) of this law.)
Based on the foregoing and guided by it, and after reviewing the papers and documents submitted by the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> in its capacity as the bankruptcy manager for the bankrupt Ahmed Abdulrahman Ibrahim Al-Yahya <orig>احمد عبد الرحمن إبراهيم اليحيى</orig>, including the financial summary of the bankruptcy and the Authority's conclusion that the bankrupt has no funds, and therefore, in application of the provisions of Articles 196, 197, and 198 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 and its executive regulations, the bankruptcy judge finds that the Authority's request is based on a sound foundation in fact and law, considering that the Authority has taken all measures and attempted to collect the debts owed by the bankrupt and has concluded that he has no assets that can be executed upon. This necessitates the closure of the bankruptcy in accordance with the provisions of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 and its executive regulations due to the insufficiency of his bankruptcy funds. Consequently, each creditor regains the right to take individual actions and file individual lawsuits against the bankrupt. The Authority, in its capacity as the bankruptcy trustee, shall be responsible for a period of one year from the date of the bankruptcy closure decision for the documents delivered to it by the creditors. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة افلاس</orig> must publish the bankruptcy closure decision, announce it by a notice posted at the Administration's headquarters, and register it within ten working days from the date of its issuance, as will be stated in the operative part.
Therefore,
The bankruptcy of the bankrupt, Ahmed Abdulrahman Ibrahim Al-Yahya <orig>احمد عبد الرحمن إبراهيم اليحيى</orig>, subject of the final judgment issued in Case No. 2005/188 Public Debts Bankruptcy on 14/2/2006, is closed due to the insufficiency of his funds. Each creditor has the right to take measures and file individual lawsuits against the bankrupt. The Authority, in its capacity as the bankruptcy trustee, shall be responsible for a period of one year from the date of the bankruptcy closure decision for the documents delivered to it by the creditors. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة افلاس</orig> shall publish the bankruptcy closure decision in the Official Gazette and announce it by a notice posted at the Administration's headquarters in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 71 of 2020 and its executive regulations, and the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة افلاس</orig> shall register it in its electronic register according to the law.

Clerk of the Court
Bankruptcy Judge

)
It is also established, under the provision of Article 21 of Law No. 41 of 1993 regarding the State's purchase of certain debts and the method of their collection, that (if the bankruptcy is closed for insufficiency of its assets, or if interim distributions are made, and if amounts are obtained as a result of a judicial composition or a composition with abandonment of assets, and upon the termination of the bankruptcy and in all cases where interim or final distributions are made in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Code, the Director shall receive these funds and distribute them to the creditors according to their share in the bankruptcy, without prejudice to their rights stipulated in Articles (666) and (732) of the Commercial Code, taking into account what is stated in Article (12) of this law).
Whereas, based on the foregoing and guided by it, and after reviewing the papers and documents submitted by the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> in its capacity as the bankruptcy administrator for the bankrupt Mohammed Naseeb Al-Musaieed Al-Randi <orig>محمد نصيب المسيعيد الرندي</orig>, including the financial summary of the bankruptcy and the Authority's conclusion that the bankrupt has no assets, therefore, in application of the provisions of Articles 196, 197, and 198 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 and its executive regulations, the Bankruptcy Judge finds that the Authority's request is based on a sound foundation in fact and law, considering that the Authority has taken all measures and attempted to collect the debts owed by the bankrupt and has concluded that he has no assets that can be executed upon. This entails the closure of the bankruptcy in accordance with the provisions of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 and its executive regulations due to the insufficiency of his bankruptcy assets. Consequently, each creditor shall regain the right to take individual actions and file individual lawsuits against the bankrupt. The Authority, in its capacity as the bankruptcy trustee, shall be responsible for a period of one year from the date of the bankruptcy closure decision for the documents delivered to it by the creditors. The Bankruptcy Department must publish the bankruptcy closure decision, announce it by posting a notice at the department's headquarters, and record it within ten working days from the date of its issuance, as will be stated in the operative part.
Therefore
The bankruptcy of the bankrupt / Mohammed Naseeb Al-Musaieed Al-Randi <orig>محمد نصيب المسيعيد الرندي</orig>, subject of the final judgment issued in Case No. 15/2004 Public Debts Bankruptcy, dated 18/5/2004, is closed due to the insufficiency of his assets. Each creditor has the right to take individual actions and file individual lawsuits against the bankrupt. The Authority, in its capacity as the bankruptcy trustee, shall be responsible for a period of one year from the date of the bankruptcy closure decision for the documents delivered to it by the creditors. The Bankruptcy Department shall publish the bankruptcy closure decision and announce it by posting a notice at the department's headquarters in accordance with the provisions of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 and its executive regulations, and the Bankruptcy Department shall record it in its electronic register in accordance with the law.
Pursuant to Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge shall be executory instruments in accordance with this law. The Bankruptcy Department shall affix the writ of execution to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

Clerk of the Court
Bankruptcy Judge

## Announcement

On the occasion of the issuance of the decision by the Bankruptcy Judge / Abdullah Al-Tabtaba'i <orig>عبدالله الطبطبائي</orig> – dated 17/7/2025 in Application No. (200/2024) Declaration of Bankruptcy.
Submitted by / The Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> in its capacity as the bankruptcy administrator for the bankrupt Khalaf Mohammed Juma'a City Al-Tamimi <orig>خلف محمد جمعه سيتي التميمي</orig>.
Against / The bankrupt / Khalaf Mohammed Juma'a City Al-Tamimi <orig>خلف محمد جمعه سيتي التميمي</orig>.

Head of the Bankruptcy Department

In the name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
Court of First Instance

### Decision

On Thursday, 17/7/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department, with the membership of Mr. / Abdullah Al-Tabtaba'i <orig>عبدالله الطبطبائي</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge, and in the presence of Mr. / Othman Al-Siddi <orig>عثمان الصدي</orig>, Clerk of the Court.
In Application No: (200/2024 Declaration of Bankruptcy)
Registered under Automated No: 244381080
And registered in Case No. 151/2004 Public Debts Bankruptcy, dated 20/12/2005
Submitted by / The Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> in its capacity as the bankruptcy administrator for the bankrupt Khalaf Mohammed Juma'a City Al-Tamimi <orig>خلف محمد جمعه سيتي التميمي</orig>.
Against / The bankrupt / Khalaf Mohammed Juma'a City Al-Tamimi <orig>خلف محمد جمعه سيتي التميمي</orig>.
Whereas the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> submitted Letter No. M.A.S / 10-21/798, which includes a request to close the bankruptcy of the bankrupt Khalaf Mohammed Juma'a City Al-Tamimi <orig>خلف محمد جمعه سيتي التميمي</orig> due to the absence of assets belonging to the bankruptcy, in accordance with Article 196 of Law No. 71 of 2020.
Based on the foregoing, it is established by the provision of Article 196 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 that (if the bankruptcy proceedings are suspended for insufficiency of assets before the ratification of the judicial composition, the Bankruptcy Judge may decide to close it. The decision to close the bankruptcy for insufficiency of its assets shall result in each creditor regaining the right to take individual actions and file individual lawsuits. If the creditor's debt has been verified and finally accepted in the bankruptcy, he may execute against the debtor in accordance with the provisions of Article (195) of this Law.
The bankruptcy trustee shall be responsible for a period of one year from the date of the bankruptcy closure decision for the documents delivered to him by the creditors).
Article 197 stipulates that (The bankrupt and any interested party may request the Bankruptcy Judge to revoke the decision to close the bankruptcy if it is proven that there is sufficient property to cover the expenses of the bankruptcy proceedings, or if a sufficient amount for this purpose is delivered to the trustee.)
Article 198 stipulates that (The Bankruptcy Department shall publish, announce, and record the decision to close the bankruptcy within five working days from the date of its issuance.)

**The Minister:** The Minister of Higher Education <orig>وزير التعليم العالي</orig>.

**The Authority:** The National Authority for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.

**Scholarships and Grants Committee <orig>لجنة البعثات والمنح</orig>:** A committee formed by a ministerial decision, chaired by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>, and includes specialists from the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>. It is entrusted with the task of implementing all decisions and regulations concerning Kuwaiti students sent to study abroad.

**The Cultural Office <orig>المكتب الثقافي</orig>:** An office under the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>, responsible for following up on the admission of Kuwaiti students sent to educational institutions outside the State of Kuwait, supervising their financial and living conditions, monitoring their academic status with educational institutions, and establishing cultural relations with educational institutions, scientific research centers, and various cultural bodies and organizations in those countries.

**The Academic Committee <orig>اللجنة الأكاديمية</orig>:** A committee emanating from the Cultural Office <orig>المكتب الثقافي</orig>, formed with the Head of the Office or the Cultural Attaché <orig>الملحق الثقافي</orig> as its chairman, and includes specialists from the members of the Cultural Office. Its mission is to implement all decisions and regulations concerning Kuwaiti students sent to study abroad.

**The Scholarship Mission <orig>البعثة الدراسية</orig>:** The dispatch of a Kuwaiti student or their inclusion in one of the educational institutions outside the State of Kuwait recommended by the Authority, to obtain the academic qualification for which they were sent, within the period specified for the study program and in accordance with the procedures and requirements stipulated in these regulations.

**The Study Grant <orig>المنحة الدراسية</orig>:** The annual academic seats offered by brotherly and friendly nations to Kuwaiti students in exchange for the seats offered by the State of Kuwait to students from those nations, in accordance with cultural agreements between the State of Kuwait and those nations as per cultural exchange programs and foreign relations.

**The Scholarship Plan <orig>خطة البعثات</orig>:** The academic seats announced by the Ministry of Higher Education in various specializations in the countries of dispatch outside the State of Kuwait, in coordination with the Cultural Offices, for which Kuwaiti students who meet the admission requirements can apply to be sent to study for a first university degree (Bachelor's), according to the needs of state institutions, the labor market, and the development plan.

**The Grant Plan <orig>خطة المنح</orig>:** The annual announcement of the seats offered by brotherly and friendly nations to the citizens of the State of Kuwait, for which Kuwaiti students who meet the admission requirements can apply, and who are selected based on the highest submitted grade point averages.

**Scholarship Student <orig>طالب البعثة</orig>:** A Kuwaiti student who has been accepted into one of the Ministry's scholarship plans, or who has been included after meeting the inclusion requirements, or to whom the regulations for children of Kuwaiti diplomats apply, to study outside Kuwait to obtain the academic qualification for which they were sent.

**Grant Student <orig>طالب المنحة</orig>:** A Kuwaiti student who has been accepted into one of the grant programs offered by a brotherly or friendly nation based on a cultural exchange agreement, to obtain the academic qualification for which they were sent.

**Country of Dispatch <orig>بلد الإيفاد</orig>:** The country where the educational institution to which the Kuwaiti student is sent to obtain the academic qualification is located.

**Granting Country <orig>الدولة المانحة</orig>:** The country that grants seats to Kuwaiti students based on the cultural exchange agreement between it and the State of Kuwait.

**Place of Study <orig>مقر الدراسة</orig>:** The country or city where the educational institution in which the Kuwaiti student receives their studies or training is located.

**Educational Institution <orig>المؤسسة التعليمية</orig>:** The university or college outside the State of Kuwait where the Kuwaiti student receives their education to obtain the academic qualification for which they were sent, and which is included in the lists recommended by the Authority.

**Distinguished Scholarship Program <orig>برنامج البعثات المتميزة</orig>:** The dispatch of Kuwaiti students who have obtained final admission to one of the distinguished programs or from one of the distinguished educational institutions listed in the Authority's lists of excellence.

**Direct Dispatch Program <orig>برنامج الإيفاد المباشر</orig>:** The dispatch of Kuwaiti students who have obtained final admission from one of the educational institutions recommended by the Authority in one of the specializations determined by the Ministry in one of the countries of dispatch, according to the needs of the labor market.

**Advanced Medicine Program <orig>برنامج الطب المتقدم</orig>:** The dispatch of Kuwaiti students who hold a first university degree (Bachelor's) in one of the scientific specializations (Engineering - Sciences - Allied Health Sciences - Pharmacy) to a four-year graduate-entry human medicine program (GRADUATE-ENTRY) to obtain a Bachelor's degree in one of the countries of dispatch.

**Unified National Aptitude Tests <orig>الاختبارات الوطنية الموحدة لقياس القدرات</orig>:** A set of tests to determine the readiness of Kuwaiti students to enroll in academic studies.

**Equivalent GPA <orig>المعدل المكافئ</orig>:** The calculated and weighted grade point average for a student based on their high school GPA and their score on the Unified National Aptitude Tests.

**Study Plan <orig>الخطة الدراسية</orig>:** The approved academic program in which the Kuwaiti student enrolls, consisting of a number of courses that the student must successfully complete within the actual duration of the study program.

**Academic Year <orig>العام الدراسي</orig>:** The beginning and end of studies in a single year, according to the system of the accredited educational institutions in the country of dispatch, which is less than a year

**Academic Semester:** The period of time according to the system in place at the educational institution in which the student is enrolled, during which the student passes the required number of credit units according to the semester system, and in which the student selects the courses necessary for graduation each semester until they complete the graduation requirements. It is divided into a two-semester system or a three-semester system.

**Preparatory Year:**

**Foundation year:** The post-secondary academic stage that qualifies a student to continue their academic studies.

**Premiere Et Deuxieme Degree Diploma:** The study that qualifies a student studying in France to obtain a third-degree diploma or to gain admission to the first university year.

**Academic Study Stage:** The Kuwaiti student's study of the major subjects for which they were sent, at the educational institution in which they are enrolled and which is recommended by the Apparatus <orig>الجهاز</orig>.

**Course Load:** The number of courses, ranging between a minimum and a maximum, in which a student enrolls according to the semester or annual system.

**Semester GPA:** The level of grades or points a student obtains after completing examinations for courses under the semester system.

**Annual GPA:** The level of grades or points a student obtains after completing examinations for courses under the annual system.

**Final GPA:** The level of grades or points a student obtains after completing the entire academic program and receiving the academic qualification for which they were sent.

**Annual Completion:** The number of courses a student passes in a single academic year under the semester or annual system.

**Academic Probation:** The student's failure to meet the minimum course load during the academic stage in the major for which they were sent, or their failure to achieve the minimum (annual/semester) GPA required by the educational institution.

**Change of Major:** The student's changing from the major for which they were sent to another major during the academic study stage.

**Joining the Program:** The acceptance of a Kuwaiti student studying at their own expense into the Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> scholarships or grants after fulfilling the conditions for joining.

**Rejoining the Program:** The reinstatement of a Kuwaiti student who withdrew after enrollment or was dismissed from the scholarship or grant, after fulfilling the conditions for rejoining.

**Deferment:** A temporary suspension of the scholarship or grant.

**Extension:** An increase in the time period for the scholarship or grant.

**Optional Practical Training (OPT):** The student's enrollment, via a temporary work permit for a period of 12 months after graduation, in an institution directly related to the student's major, in order to refine and enhance the student's practical skills and gain global experience by engaging in a real-world work environment.

**Internship Course:** A required course within the major's study plan, whereby the student undertakes a field placement at an institution to gain practical experience by linking the academic aspect with practical application.

**Medical Leave:** The deferment of a student's scholarship or grant for a medical reason upon their request, in accordance with a medical report certified by the competent authorities in the country of study or by the competent authorities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

**Withdrawal:** The student's desire to discontinue their studies under the scholarship or grant.

**Cancellation:** The cancellation of an accepted student's scholarship or grant for failure to complete registration procedures within sixty days from the date the results are announced.

**Student Dismissal:** The termination of a student's scholarship or grant due to repeated failure, dismissal from the educational institution, or commission of any of the violations stipulated in the regulations.

**Disciplinary Warning:** A warning issued to a student as a result of violating the governing laws and regulations in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or any other country.

**Academic Warning:** A warning issued to a student as a result of violating the decisions and regulations governing the scholarship or grant, or in the event of a drop in GPA according to the system followed in each country of study.

**Student's Companion:** The person who accompanies the student, being a Kuwaiti husband or Kuwaiti wife and Kuwaiti children, and those of similar status from the citizens of the Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون</orig> countries.

**Financial Stipends:** All monthly financial allocations disbursed to the scholarship or grant student in accordance with the applicable systems and regulations.

**Tuition Fees:** The financial amounts due from the student to educational institutions in exchange for their enrollment in an accredited study program.

**Financial Allowances:** Additional financial amounts disbursed to the student to cover specific costs in accordance with the applicable systems and regulations.

**Indebtedness:** The amounts due from the student for violating one of the controls stipulated in the regulations.

**Financial Claim:** The recovery of the value of the indebtedness incurred by the student as a result of violating one of the controls stipulated in the regulations.

**Financial Claims Committee:** A committee formed by a ministerial decision <orig>قرار وزاري</orig> to consider grievances

## Article (2)
### Conditions for Registering Scholarship and Grant Students
1. Must be a Kuwaiti national.
2. The applicant's age must not be less than (16) years and not more than (23) years.
3. Must hold a high school certificate in accordance with the conditions stipulated in Article (3) of the regulations.
4. The percentage score must not be less than the minimum required for admission to the annual scholarship plan or the grant plan.
5. Must not hold a first university degree (Bachelor's).
6. Must not have received a scholarship within the State of Kuwait or a grant to obtain a first university degree (Bachelor's), unless the amount spent has been reimbursed.
7. Must not have received an external scholarship or grant that ended in dismissal or withdrawal after enrolling in the country of dispatch.
8. The applicant may not combine a scholarship and a grant at the same time.
9. Must not be an employee of any state entity.
10. The grant applicant must meet the conditions set by the granting country.
11. Must achieve the required score on the IELTS or TOEFL test, or the placement tests specified by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>, before enrolling in the country of dispatch, within one full calendar year from the date of announcing the admission results for the scholarship plan, taking into account the conditions stipulated in the Ministry's scholarship plans.
12. Must submit the general high school certificate or its equivalent within sixty days from the date of announcing the admission results for the scholarship plan or the grant plan.
13. The student and their legal guardian must sign the special pledge to abide by the terms of the scholarship or grant, both academically and financially, within sixty days from the date of announcing the admission results for the scholarship plan or the grant plan.

## Article (3)
### Conditions for the Student's High School Certificate
#### First: General Conditions:
1. The certificate's validity must not exceed two academic years from the date of graduation, with the exception of the English high school certificate.
2. Must hold a Kuwaiti General High School Certificate (Unified System) in its scientific and literary tracks only, or equivalent high school certificates accredited by the Private Education Department of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.

#### Second: Conditions for the English High School Certificate:
1. Passing at least eight academic subjects, two or more of which must be at the Advanced Subsidiary Level (AS-Level) or Advanced Level (A-Level), with the remainder at the Ordinary Level (IGCSE), within a period not exceeding thirty-six months from the date of graduation. Subjects passed longer than this period will not be considered.
2. Grades from the AS-Level & A-Level are not included in the percentage calculation.
3. A student is classified as a graduate of the scientific track of high school upon passing these subjects (Mathematics – Physics – Chemistry – Biology).
4. A student is classified as a graduate of the literary track if they have not passed one of the scientific subjects mentioned in clause (3) above.
5. Subjects in which the student obtained a grade of (C) or higher are counted, with the allowance of counting only one subject with a grade of (D) for the eight required subjects (AS-IGCSE), and in accordance with the conditions of educational institutions for certain specializations.
6. The grades obtained by the student in IGCSE subjects are assigned the following percentages:

<table_caption>IGCSE Grade to Percentage Conversion</table_caption>
<table>
| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 | Column 4 | Column 5 | Column 6 | Column 7 |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| A* = 100 | A = 95 | B = 85 | C = 75 | D = 65 | - | - |
| 9 = 100 | 8 = 98 | 7 = 95 | 6 = 88 | 5 = 82 | 4 = 75 | 3 = 62 |
</table>

7. Academic subjects from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> curriculum (Arabic Language, Islamic Education, Holy Quran) are not counted.
8. Non-academic subjects (Music, Physical Education, Theater, Art Education, etc.) are not counted unless the student provides an official statement from their graduating school confirming that the subject is academic.

#### Third: Conditions for the American High School Diploma:
- A student is classified as a graduate of the scientific track of high school upon successfully passing these subjects (Biology-Chemistry-Physics-Algebra 2-Calculus or Pre-Calculus) during two regular academic semesters, not as an intensive semester.

#### Fourth: Conditions for the International Baccalaureate Diploma (IB – DP):
1. The student must have completed (12) years of schooling and submit the final, accredited International Baccalaureate diploma.
2. Successful completion of at least (6) subjects from the International Baccalaureate curriculum.
3. Passing at least three subjects at the High Level (HL).
4. Passing Mathematics and English among the six required subjects.
5. The student must pass Theory of Knowledge (TOK) and the Extended Essay (EE).
6. To be considered a scientific track International Baccalaureate diploma, the student must pass two science subjects (Chemistry, Biology, Physics) and one mathematics subject.

## Article (4)
## Duties of the Scholarship and Grant Student

1- To maintain good conduct and behavior throughout the period of study, both inside and outside educational institutions.
2- To uphold the country's reputation abroad and adhere to good values and morals.
3- To be diligent, hardworking, and perseverant during the academic stages and to acquire diverse experiences to transfer knowledge and the latest advancements of modern science to the country.
4- To respect and abide by the laws and regulations both inside and outside the State of Kuwait, and to comply with the immigration and housing laws in the country of dispatch.
5- To adhere to all decisions and regulations governing scholarships, grants, and the equivalency of academic certificates.
6- To commit to and comply with the rules and regulations of the educational institution in which they are enrolled.
7- To adhere to the controls stipulated in Article (6) regarding changing the country of dispatch.
8- To adhere to the controls stipulated in Article (7) regarding changing the educational institution.
9- To adhere to the controls stipulated in Article (8) regarding changing the major.
10- To maintain continuous communication and coordination with the Ministry and the Cultural Office in the country of dispatch, or the one it is affiliated with, before enrollment and during the academic stage to understand their rights and duties.
11- To notify the Cultural Office before leaving the country of dispatch during the study period, and to provide approval from the educational institution of enrollment.
12- Not to suspend enrollment or discontinue studies except for reasons beyond the student's control and after obtaining the Ministry's approval.
13- To adhere to the specified duration of study for the dispatched major and to pass the required academic units during the scholarship or grant period.
14- To authorize the Cultural Office to periodically (annually or by semester) access academic documents, records, and performance reports, in accordance with the academic system of the enrolled educational institution and as required for the regular monitoring of the student.
15- To commit to providing the Cultural Office with the study plan at the beginning of their academic studies, proof of enrollment for each semester, the official transcript for the completed semester, and exam results at the end of each semester or academic year. The student shall pledge to do so and bear responsibility for any delay in submitting the required documents.
16- To provide the Cultural Office with the reasons for poor academic performance during the study period that led to receiving an academic warning, within one month from the date of notification.
17- To be fully dedicated to studies and not to undertake any work during this period. The Ministry may permit the student to engage in training related to their academic major and study plan if it does not affect their studies and regular attendance.
18- To periodically update all personal data and communication channels and provide them to the Cultural Office and the Ministry.
19- To settle all personal, financial, and legal obligations with official authorities, at the place of residence in the country of dispatch, and with the educational institutions attended during the study period, in the event of graduation, changing the country of dispatch, withdrawal, or dismissal.

## Article (5)
## The Academic Stage

The student is permitted to undertake academic study in the country of dispatch in accordance with the following:
1- To adhere to the prescribed duration for the study program for which they were dispatched, as specified in the study plan approved by the Cultural Office.
2- To successfully pass during the academic year (27) credit units under the two-semester system (Semester) or (42) credit units under the three-term system (Quarter), or their equivalent at the enrolled educational institution, provided that these units are part of the study plan. Those who do not complete the required units must complete them during the summer session.
3- In the event the student's semester GPA falls below (2.00 points) or 50% in the British system, or its equivalent in other academic systems, an academic warning shall be issued to the student, taking into account clause (twelve) of Article (25) of the regulations, in accordance with the following:
    a) Issuing a first warning to raise the GPA during the following semester.
    b) Issuing a second warning if the low GPA persists.
    c) Dismissal of the student upon receiving three consecutive or four non-consecutive warnings.
    d) A maximum of two academic warnings may be rescinded for a student who experiences compelling circumstances, subject to the Ministry's approval.
    e) The warning may be rescinded for a third time, as a maximum, for a student to complete graduation requirements according to the academic regulations.

4- In the event the student fails to attend lectures without an excuse acceptable to the educational institution, the system of deduction from the monthly allowances shall be applied in accordance with clause (eleven) of Article (25) of the regulations.
5- Studying two courses at a community college, provided that they do not exceed (8) credit hours, if they are among the credits required by the educational institution in which the student is enrolled and are not available there, after obtaining the approval of that educational institution to count them within the study plan.
6- Studying one semester under the semester system and one academic year under the annual system outside the country of dispatch, if this is mandatory for the student and a graduation requirement, after obtaining prior approval from the educational institution in which the student is enrolled and the Ministry.
7- The student is permitted to study an optional semester outside the country of dispatch or to enroll in a field training course during the study period, after the approval of the educational institution in which the student is enrolled and the approval of the Ministry, without the Ministry bearing any additional costs beyond the study expenses.
8- The student is permitted to spend a training period inside the State of Kuwait, after the approval of the educational institution and the Ministry, in accordance with clause (9) of Part One of Article (25) of the regulations.
9- Studying (6) academic courses or a number of credits not exceeding (18) credit hours through a non-traditional education system, provided the following conditions are met:
    a) - The student must provide the Cultural Office, prior to enrollment, with a statement issued by the educational institution in which they are enrolled regarding the course and the system of study.
    b) Obtaining prior approval from the Ministry to enroll in the desired course.
    c) The course must be at one of the recommended universities, subject to the approval of the university in which the student is enrolled.
    d) The following courses or their equivalents are not considered non-traditional courses:
    - Bachelor's level courses:
    (Senior design – capstone – technical skills – word – excel – power point)
    - Master's level courses:
    (Research thesis – Dissertation – independent study – senior)
10- Registering for academic courses at an accredited educational institution in the country of dispatch, after the approval of the educational institution in which the student is enrolled, provided that the number of credit hours does not exceed the limit allowed by the educational institution in which the student is enrolled, taking into account the scheduling of courses, after obtaining the approval of the Cultural Office.
11- Registering for summer semester courses at an accredited public or private educational institution within the State of Kuwait, or at a recommended educational institution outside the country of dispatch, after the approval of the educational institution in which the student is enrolled, provided that the number of courses does not exceed a maximum of two courses throughout the entire study period, with a grade of no less than Good (C).
12- Registering for less than the approved academic load at the institution in which the student is enrolled if it is a graduation requirement, with the possibility of reducing the academic load based on exceptional circumstances assessed by the Ministry.
13- The student is not permitted to study courses or take exams by correspondence or through affiliation programs.
14- The student is not permitted to retake courses that have been successfully passed with a grade of (Good) or higher, or its equivalent in other systems.

## Article (6)
### Repeating the Academic Year
A student may repeat the academic year in accordance with the following:
1- Repeating the preparatory year only once in the same specialization, provided that their attendance rate during the academic year is not less than (65%) or at rates that do not violate the immigration laws in the countries of dispatch.
2- Repeating an academic year a maximum of two times, provided that this is counted within the program's duration.
3- If the student exhausts the maximum number of repetitions, the scholarship or grant shall be frozen.

## Article (7)
### Changing the Country of Dispatch
First: A student may change the country of dispatch after actual enrollment, in accordance with the following conditions:
1- The change may be made only once, taking into account the remaining duration of the scholarship.
2- The specialization must be listed in the Ministry's scholarship plan for the intended country of dispatch in the same academic year the student was accepted.
3- The student's grade average must not be less than the minimum percentage announced for the specialization in the Ministry's scholarship plan for the same academic year they were accepted and for the country to which they wish to transfer.
4- Submitting supporting documents for the change request and obtaining the Ministry's approval.

Second: The change may occur in the following cases:
1- Refusal or delay in the issuance or renewal of the travel visa for a period of 3 months or more.
2- The presence of a sibling in the country to which the student wishes to transfer.
3- Obtaining admission into one of the medical specializations.
