# Article (8)
## Changing the Educational Institution
First: The scholarship student may request to transfer to another educational institution within the host country after passing the foundation year or during the academic study period, in accordance with the following:
1. Obtaining the approval of the Ministry before enrolling in the educational institution to which the transfer is desired. The student must submit supporting documents for the change request.
2. The educational institution must be recommended by the Authority <orig>الجهاز</orig>, be a destination for Ministry scholarships, and be included in the Ministry's scholarship plan for the same academic year in which the student was accepted and for subsequent years.
3. The remaining period of study after the transfer must not be less than two semesters under the semester system, three quarters under the quarter system, or one academic year under the annual system.
4. Changing the educational institution is permitted twice during the academic study period, taking into account the remaining duration of the scholarship.
5. The student is permitted to change for a third time in the following cases:
a) Obtaining admission to a distinguished program or from a distinguished educational institution on the Authority's <orig>الجهاز</orig> lists.
b) Transferring from an educational institution that has been academically blacklisted.
c) Enrolling in a (TOP UP YEAR) to obtain the academic degree.
Second: The grant student is not permitted to change the educational institution to which they were sent for study.

# Article (9)
## Changing the Major
First: The student is permitted to request a change of major after passing the foundation year or during the academic study phase, in accordance with the following:
1. Obtaining academic admission from an educational institution recommended by the Authority <orig>الجهاز</orig> in a major included in the scholarship plan for the same academic year in which the student was accepted and for the host country.
2. Meeting the academic requirements according to the study system:
- Semester System: Passing a minimum of (12) credit hours with a minimum overall GPA of (2.00).
- Annual System: Successfully completing the foundation or first year.
3. The change may only be made once after actual enrollment and upon obtaining the Ministry's approval.
Second: The scholarship student is permitted to request a change of major more than once during the academic study phase if they obtain admission to a distinguished program or transfer to a distinguished educational institution, provided the change does not exceed two times.
Third: The scholarship student is permitted to request a change of major to another major not included in the Ministry's scholarship plan during the academic study phase if they obtain admission to a distinguished program or transfer to a distinguished educational institution, provided the change does not exceed two times.
Fourth: The scholarship student is not permitted to change their major if they have completed half of the study plan for the major for which they were sent.
Fifth: The student is not permitted to change their major before actual enrollment in the host country.
Sixth: The grant student is not permitted to request a change of the major for which they were sent except with the approval of the granting educational institution and the Ministry.

# Article (10)
## Deferment
First: The student's scholarship or grant shall be postponed for a maximum of one academic year if they do not obtain a travel visa, for health reasons based on a certified medical report from the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, or for other exceptional reasons accepted by the Ministry, and with the approval of the granting state for a grant student.
Second: The scholarship or grant shall be deferred upon the approval of the Ministry, and the granting state for a grant student, for a period not exceeding two academic years throughout the duration of the study plan in the following cases:
1. If the student encounters a compelling circumstance that requires them to leave the host country, by submitting a deferment request explaining the reasons and the deferment period.
2. If the student does not obtain academic admission for reasons beyond their control.
3. If the educational institution does not approve repeating a failed year, and the student is unable to find admission at another educational institution.
4. If the student fails and the educational institution requires them to be an unenrolled student who only sits for the final examinations, the scholarship will be deferred and then reinstated two months before the examinations.
5. If their GPA drops and they are suspended by the educational institution.
6. If the student is dismissed from the educational institution and has not exhausted the Ministry's academic warnings.
7. If the original duration of the scholarship or grant has ended and the student has exhausted the extension period stipulated in Article (11), the scholarship will be deferred until graduation, for a maximum of one academic year.

10- Failure to provide proof of enrollment or registration at the educational institution and submit it to the Cultural Office.
Thirdly: The student is not permitted to freeze the scholarship or grant before actual enrollment in the country of dispatch.

# Article (11)
## Extension of the Academic Stage
Firstly: A request may be made to extend the academic stage to complete graduation requirements for a maximum of two academic years throughout the duration of the study plan, subject to the Ministry's approval.
Secondly: The student's scholarship or grant shall not be extended if they fail to pass the academic units or academic years equivalent to the midpoint of the approved study plan for the major for which they were dispatched at the institution where they are enrolled.
Thirdly: The grant student must obtain prior approval from the educational institution in which they are enrolled.

# Article (12)
## Dismissal of the Student
A student shall be dismissed in one of the following cases:
1- If they breach any of the clauses stipulated in Articles (2) and (4) of the regulations.
2- Discontinuation of or withdrawal from studies without reasons acceptable to the Ministry for a period not exceeding one academic year.
3- If a decision is issued to freeze the scholarship or grant and they fail to obtain academic admission within the freeze period stipulated in Article (10) of the regulations.
4- If a decision is issued to freeze the scholarship or grant until graduation and they do not complete the graduation requirements within one academic year.
5- If they are convicted of any type of crime by the competent authorities within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or any other country.
6- If they fail for two consecutive or non-consecutive years in majors with a study duration of four years or less.
7- If they fail for two consecutive or three non-consecutive years in majors with a study duration of more than four years.
8- If they receive three consecutive or four non-consecutive academic warnings regarding their semesterly or annual GPA, in accordance with the study system.
9- If they receive two disciplinary warnings.

# Article (13)
## Cancellation
Firstly: The student's scholarship or grant shall be cancelled in the following cases:
1. Failure to complete registration procedures within sixty days of the announcement of admission results.
2. Failure to enroll in the educational institution within a maximum period of one academic year after completing the scholarship or grant procedures.
3. Failure to achieve the required score in the IELTS or TOEFL test in accordance with clause (10) of Article (2) of the regulations.
Secondly: The student may register for subsequent scholarship plans after fulfilling all the conditions stipulated in Articles (2) and (3) of the regulations.

# Article (14)
## Withdrawal
Firstly: The student is permitted to withdraw before completing registration procedures or before enrolling in the country of dispatch, taking into account the following:
1- The withdrawal decision may not be rescinded after it has been issued.
2- The student may register for subsequent scholarship plans after fulfilling all the conditions stipulated in Articles (2) and (3) of the regulations.
Secondly: The student is permitted to withdraw during the period of study, subject to payment of the financial claim that will result from the withdrawal decision, in accordance with the applicable systems and regulations.

# Article (15)
## Conditions for Joining a Scholarship or Grant
Firstly: A student may submit a request to join a scholarship or grant if the following conditions are met:
1- Must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
2- The applicant's age must not exceed 25 years at the time of submitting the request to join.
3- The applicant must be continuously enrolled in their studies and must not have been discontinued from their studies for a period exceeding one academic year at the time of submitting the request to join.
4- Must hold a General Secondary School Certificate or its equivalent in accordance with the conditions stipulated in Article (3) of the regulations, and it is not required for the student to have obtained the Advanced Subsidiary Level (AS-LEVEL) or the Advanced Level (A-LEVEL).
5- Must not hold a first university degree (Bachelor's) or its equivalent.
6- Must not be an employee of any state entity during the period of study and at the time of submitting the request to join.
7- Their major must be one of the majors offered in the scholarship or grant plan for the same academic year in which they enrolled, in the same country of enrollment, and at one of the educational institutions recommended by the Apparatus.

10- Admission must be at the beginning of the academic year or the first or second semester. Admission is not permitted during the summer semester, and proof of progression to the next academic year must be provided.
11- A Kuwaiti student may be admitted to the scholarship if he/she is accepted in one of the donor countries and meets the conditions of the scholarships offered to the State of Kuwait by that country, provided that the scholarship is designated for the academic year in which it is offered.
12- A student enrolled in a distinguished program or at a distinguished educational institution in a major not listed in the Ministry's scholarship plan may be admitted in accordance with the regulations stipulated in Article (17).

Second: Students may be admitted to the Ministry's scholarships at universities that follow the annual system in the following cases:
1- Successfully passing the first or preparatory academic year and obtaining admission for the following academic year.
2- Passing the French Studies Diploma, Second Degree (Deuxième Degré) with a grade of (Fair – Assez Bien) and having obtained admission to the first university year.

Third: Students may be admitted to the Ministry's scholarships at universities that follow the credit hour system in the following cases:
1- Passing no less than (27) credit hours in the two-semester system (Semester) or (42) credit hours in the three-term system (Quarter), or its equivalent, at the educational institution in which he/she is enrolled.
2- These units must be from an educational institution recommended by the Apparatus in the same country.
3- The cumulative GPA must not be less than (2.5) or its equivalent in other academic systems.

Fourth: Students holding a diploma from applied colleges may be admitted to the Ministry's scholarships if the following conditions are met:
1- Must be a Kuwaiti national.
2- The applicant's age must not exceed 27 years at the time of submitting the scholarship admission application.
3- The educational institution must have granted him/her an equivalency of at least one academic year from the applied colleges diploma, with at least two academic years remaining for the student.
4- Must meet all the conditions stipulated in the ministerial decrees regulating certificate equivalency.
5- His/her major must be one of the majors offered in the Ministry's scholarship plans in one of the dispatch countries for the same year he/she enrolled in the study.
6- A student enrolled in a distinguished program or at a distinguished educational institution in a major not listed in the Ministry's scholarship plan may be admitted in accordance with the regulations stipulated in Article (17).
7- Must not be an employee of any state entity during the study and at the time of submitting the admission application.
8- Must successfully pass the first academic year in the annual system, or complete (27) credit hours in the semester system or its equivalent at the educational institution in which he/she is enrolled, with a cumulative GPA of (2.5) or its equivalent in other academic systems.
9- The student is granted the remaining duration of the academic program in which he/she is enrolled.
10- Admission shall be at the beginning of the first and second semesters for the semester system and at the beginning of the academic year for the annual system. Admission is not permitted during the summer semester, taking into account the date of application submission and completion of required documents.

# Article (16)
## Conditions for Re-admission to the Scholarship or Grant
First: A student may submit a request for re-admission after dismissal or withdrawal only once if the following conditions are met:
1- The re-admission request must be submitted within two years from the date of the dismissal or withdrawal decision, provided that the approved duration of the academic program has not been exhausted.
2- The reason for dismissal must not be disciplinary, unless he/she has been reinstated and the disciplinary dismissal decision has been rescinded.
3- Must not be an employee of any state entity during the study and at the time of submitting the re-admission application.
4- The major must be one of the majors offered in the scholarship plan for the same year he/she initially joined the scholarship or grant and in the same country of enrollment, at an educational institution recommended by the Apparatus.
5- The number of units completed during the period of his/her dismissal or withdrawal from the scholarship must not be less than (27) credit hours in the two-semester system (Semester) or (42) credit hours in the three-term system (Quarter), or its equivalent, at the educational institution in which he/she is enrolled, provided that it includes two courses from the major's subjects, and from an educational institution recommended by the Apparatus in one of the dispatch countries.
6- The cumulative GPA must not be less than (2.5) or its equivalent in other systems
7- Must meet all the conditions stipulated in the ministerial decrees regulating certificate equivalency.

## Article (17)
### Distinguished Scholarship Program
**First:** A student is permitted to enroll in the Distinguished Scholarship Program in accordance with the following:
1- To meet all the general conditions for a regular scholarship as stated in Articles (2) and (3) of the regulations.
2- The percentage score must not be less than the minimum required for admission to the Ministry's scholarship plan for the same specialization listed in the country of dispatch.
3- To have obtained academic admission to one of the distinguished programs or one of the educational institutions listed in the lists of excellence recommended by the Agency.
4- In the event that the student obtains admission in a specialization not listed in the country of dispatch, they must meet the lowest announced percentage for registration in the scholarship plan in that same country, with the exception of medical specializations, in accordance with the regulatory decisions of the annual scholarship plan.
5- To adhere to all the duties stated in Article (4) of the regulations.

**Second:** The student is permitted to change their specialization a maximum of two times during the scholarship period, provided that the program is distinguished or the educational institution is distinguished, taking into account the provisions stated in Article No. (9) of the regulations.

**Third:** A student's regular scholarship shall be converted to a distinguished scholarship in the following semester if they obtain academic admission to one of the distinguished programs or from one of the educational institutions listed in the lists of excellence recommended by the Agency.

**Fourth:** A student's scholarship shall be converted to a regular scholarship in the following semester or year in the following cases:
1- If they exhaust the approved duration of the program without graduating.
2- If the cumulative GPA drops below (2.67) for students in educational institutions that follow the credit hour system, or below 60% in the British system or its equivalent in other academic systems.
3- If they transfer to an educational institution not on the lists of excellence and the specialization is one of those offered in the Ministry's scholarship plans, taking into account the provisions stated in Article (9) of the regulations.
4- If they pass a number of academic units less than the minimum academic load for a regular semester in the semester system, or fail to successfully pass the academic year in the annual system, or its equivalent in other academic systems.
5- If they study more than two courses and their labs in specializations or educational institutions not on the lists of excellence recommended by the Agency.
6- If they exceed the number of courses permitted to be studied through non-traditional methods.

**Fifth:** A student's regular scholarship shall be restored to a distinguished scholarship in the following semester or year in the following cases:
1- If the cumulative GPA is raised to (2.67) or above, or 60% in the British system or its equivalent in other academic systems.
2- If they pass the minimum academic load for two consecutive regular semesters from the end of the semester in which the distinguished scholarship was canceled (if studying under the semester system), or if they successfully pass the academic year in the annual system, or its equivalent in other academic systems.

**Sixth:** A student may be admitted to the Distinguished Scholarship Program in accordance with the following:
1- Upon meeting the conditions for the distinguished scholarship and the conditions stated in Article (15).
2- They are granted the remaining period of the approved study plan, provided that it does not exceed the duration of the program to which they are being admitted.

**Seventh:** A student may be reinstated to the Distinguished Scholarship Program in accordance with the following:
1- The student is granted the remaining period of the approved study plan prior to dismissal or withdrawal, provided that it does not exceed the duration of the program to which they are being reinstated, taking into account the provisions stated in Article (16) of the regulations.
2- The student must pass a number of accredited units of no less than (15) academic units with a cumulative GPA of no less than (2.67) or its equivalent in other academic systems.

**Eighth:** The provisions stated in the regulations shall apply to all students accepted into the Distinguished Scholarship Program, provided they do not contradict the provisions stipulated in this article.

## Article (18)
### Direct Dispatch Program
A student who has obtained final admission from one of the educational institutions recommended by the Agency in one of the specializations determined by the Ministry in one of the dispatch countries, according to the needs of the labor market and in accordance with the Ministry's annual plan, is permitted, taking into account the following:
1- To meet all the conditions stated in Articles (2) and (3) of the regulations.

## Article (19)
### Advanced Medicine Program
**First:** Holders of a first university degree (Bachelor's) are permitted to be sent on scholarship for the advanced human medicine program according to the following conditions:
1- Must be a Kuwaiti national.
2- The applicant's age must not exceed (30) Gregorian years at the time of application.
3- Must hold a Kuwaiti high school certificate or its equivalent in the science stream.
4- Must hold only a first university degree – Bachelor's – (BSc- Honours) (level 8) or its equivalent in one of the scientific specializations (Engineering, Allied Health Sciences, Pharmacy), with a general grade of no less than:
- In the British and Irish system: (Second Class Honours Grade 1) 2.1
- In the American system: (3.00)
- In the Australian system: (Credit)
- In the New Zealand system: (Very Good)
- A grade of (Very Good) in other systems
- Or its equivalent in other systems.
5- Must have obtained a final acceptance (GRADUATE ENTRY) for a duration not exceeding four years from one of the educational institutions recommended by the Authority to which the Ministry sends students in one of the scholarship countries.
6- Must achieve the required score in the IELTS or TOEFL test, or the placement tests specified by the Ministry, taking into account the conditions stipulated for registration in the program.
7- Must not be an employee of any state entity, on study leave, or on a scholarship from any other entity.
8- Holders of second and third university degrees (Master's and Doctorate) are not permitted to apply for the program.

**Second:** The student must adhere to all duties stipulated in Article (4) of this regulation.

**Third:** The student is not permitted to change specialization during the advanced medicine stage.

**Fourth:** The student is not permitted to change the country of scholarship during the advanced medicine stage.

**Fifth:** All clauses stipulated in this regulation shall apply to advanced medicine students, provided they do not conflict with the clauses stipulated in this article.

## Article (20)
### Field Training Program (OPT)
Graduating scholarship students are permitted to enroll in the Optional Practical Training program at their scholarship location according to the following:
1- The cumulative GPA must not be less than (3.00) or its equivalent in other academic systems.
2- The student must have completed their first university degree (Bachelor's) without an extension.
3- The training period must not exceed one Gregorian year.
4- The student must complete their training immediately after obtaining their Bachelor's degree.

## Article (21)
### Master's Program
**First:** Only an external scholarship student may obtain a scholarship to study for a Master's program (second university degree) within two academic years from the date of obtaining the first university degree (Bachelor's), according to the following:
1- If they completed their first university degree studies without receiving an extension.
2- If they obtained a final GPA with a general grade of no less than:
- In the British and Irish system: (Second Class Honours Grade 1) 2.1
- In the American system: (3.25)
- In the Australian system: (Credit)
- In the New Zealand system: (Very Good)
- Or its equivalent in other systems.
3- If they have obtained acceptance for the Master's stage from an educational institution recommended by the Authority.
4- The study plan for the Master's stage must not exceed the plan approved by the Cultural Office at the time of application.

**Second:** The student must adhere to all duties stipulated in Article (4) of this regulation.

3- The course must be on an accredited campus of one of the recommended educational institutions, conditional upon the approval of the educational institution in which the student is enrolled.
Fourth: A student is not permitted to change their major or the location of their scholarship during the Master's degree stage after actual enrollment in the program.
Fifth: A student is permitted to transfer to another educational institution recommended by the Agency and to which the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> sends students, upon the Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> approval, provided that this does not affect the program's duration and graduation date.
Sixth: A student may extend the duration of the Master's program for one semester only, after submitting a letter from the educational institution explaining the reasons for the extension request.
Seventh: A student shall be dismissed from the Master's scholarship in the following cases:
1- In case of failure.
2- In case of discontinuation of studies.
3- In case of failure to obtain the Master's qualification and not graduating.
4- In case of withdrawal from the educational institution.
5- In case of exhausting the program's duration without graduating.
Taking into account the clauses mentioned in Article (12) of the regulations, in a manner that does not conflict with these clauses.
Eighth: An external scholarship student shall not be granted a scholarship to study for a Master's degree in the following cases:
1- Those who have exceeded the (6) courses permitted to be studied through non-traditional methods during the first university stage (Bachelor's degree).
2- Those who have studied courses concurrently at more than one educational institution at the same time during the first university stage (Bachelor's degree).
3- Those who have violated any of the clauses mentioned in the regulations during their studies in the first university stage (Bachelor's degree).
4- Those who have obtained the Optional Practical Training (OPT) program.
Ninth: The clauses mentioned in these regulations shall apply to Master's students, with the exception of clause (3) of (Second) of Article (7) and anything that does not contradict the clauses stipulated in the Article.

# Article (22)
## Children of Diplomats
First: The children of diplomats working in the embassies of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> abroad and their attached technical offices, or the children of diplomats whose service has ended due to retirement or death, shall be accepted into the Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> scholarships to obtain the first university degree, according to the following:
1- The diplomatic status of the member must be ongoing, or no more than (10) years must have passed since the diplomatic member's transfer to the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, or the end of their service due to retirement or death.
2- The applicant must meet all the conditions stated in Articles (2) and (3) when applying for medical specializations.
3- In the case of applying for non-medical specializations, the applicant must meet all the conditions stated in Article (2) except for clause (4), and all clauses stated in Article (3) of the regulations shall apply.
4- Students who are children of diplomats are permitted to enroll in a community college for a maximum of two academic years at the place of study.
5- Clause (1) of First of Article (9) of these regulations does not apply to the children of diplomats.
Second: The clauses mentioned in these regulations shall apply to all children of diplomats in a manner that does not contradict the clauses stipulated in this Article.

# Article (23)
## Leaves
First: Sick Leave:
A student has the right to request sick leave during the study period, subject to the Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> approval, provided that the sick leave request does not exceed one semester only during the entire academic stage, and that they submit a medical report from the competent authorities in the country of dispatch or from within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
Based on the Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> approval, a student may be granted sick leave for a second time only in critical and intractable medical cases that require hospitalization.
Second: Maternity Leave for a Female Student:
A female student has the right to request maternity leave for one semester only during the entire academic stage.
Third: Leave for the Death of a First-Degree Relative (Mother – Father – Son – Daughter):
A student has the right to request emergency leave due to the death of a first-degree relative, provided that its duration does not exceed one week only from the date of death.
Fourth: Leave for the Death of a Husband:
A female student has the right to request leave due to the death of her husband, provided that its duration does not exceed 4 months and 10 days from the date of death.
Fifth: Leave for the Death of a Wife:
A student has the right to request leave due to the death of his wife, provided that its duration does not exceed one week only from the date of death.

# Article (24)
## Disciplinary Accountability

### First: Types of Violations
1- Regulatory Violations: Anything related to the breach of decisions and regulations governing the student's scholarship or grant, for example, but not limited to (changing specialization or educational institution without approval – exceeding the number of non-traditional courses).
2- Disciplinary Violations: Anything related to the breach of laws and regulations in the State of Kuwait or any other country, for example, but not limited to (acts that disrupt the system of the educational institution in which the student is enrolled – any conduct that would harm the country's reputation abroad).
3- The type of violation committed is determined based on the recommendation of the Cultural Office upon submission of supporting documents.

### Second: Types of Penalties and Sanctions:
1- Disciplinary warning.
2- Suspension of monthly allowances.
3- Freezing of the scholarship.
4- Expulsion.

### Third:
The Undersecretary of the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وكيل وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> shall impose the sanctions, without prejudice to his right to refer criminal violations to the competent authorities in the state to take appropriate legal action.

### Fourth:
The Undersecretary of the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وكيل وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> shall delegate whomever he deems appropriate to conduct a written investigation with the student. If the student fails to appear at the scheduled time for the investigation, he forfeits his right to have his statements heard and shall be considered as having admitted to the violation attributed to him.

### Fifth:
The student is permitted to submit a grievance to the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وكيل وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> regarding the disciplinary decisions issued against him, within one month from the date of being notified of the decision. The grievance shall be reviewed and decided upon.

# Article (25)
## Financial Entitlements for Scholarship and Grant Students

### First: Financial Entitlements:
1- Upon dispatch, a bachelor's degree student is entitled to an enrollment allowance (travel preparation) in the country of dispatch and all resulting expenses, for one time only, in accordance with the organizing decisions.
2- A new student is entitled to monthly allowances from the date of arrival in the country of dispatch, up to a maximum of two weeks before the start of studies.
3- A continuing student whose scholarship has been frozen due to a delay in issuing a travel visa to enter the country of dispatch or for other reasons beyond his control is entitled to allowances for a maximum of three months.
4- A distinguished scholarship student is entitled to an additional monthly stipend of (50%) of the monthly allowance for a regular scholarship, with payment to begin after passing the preparatory stage and actual enrollment in the first academic stage.
5- A scholarship student (bachelor's stage) is entitled to an allowance for books, tools, and clothing at the beginning of each academic year according to the different academic systems and the original program duration, provided that he has passed the previous academic year.
6- A grant student is entitled to an allowance for books, tools, and clothing if the granting country does not provide these allowances, according to the regulations specific to each country.
7- A student who is permitted to undertake practical training in the country of dispatch after graduation is entitled to the allowance of a regular scholarship student for a maximum of one calendar year.
8- A student whose nature of study requires him to spend a mandatory training period outside the country of dispatch is entitled to the following, in addition to his monthly allowance:
a) The cost of a round-trip economy class airline ticket to and from the country of dispatch.
b) A daily allowance of (50) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or its equivalent in foreign currency for a period of two weeks, according to the declared exchange rate for the country where the training is conducted.
c) The prescribed fees for the training program.
9- A student whose nature of study requires him to spend a training period inside the State of Kuwait is entitled only to the monthly allowance, including the social allowance (if any) for the accompanying spouse and children in the country of dispatch, in accordance with clause (8) of Article (5) of the regulations.
10- A graduating student is paid an allowance for two months, not including any bonuses or allowances.
11- A student whose scholarship or grant was frozen for graduation purposes, with the freeze period not exceeding one academic year, shall be paid a two-month allowance upon completion of graduation requirements.
12- Graduating students who complete their studies at least one academic semester before the normal graduation period shall be paid a financial reward equivalent to one month's allowance only, provided they have not violated any clause of the Scholarships and Grants Regulations and the Equivalency Regulations.
13- A master's degree student is paid the following:
a) A one-way ticket to the country of dispatch and a return ticket upon graduation only.
b) The monthly financial allowance granted to a regular scholarship student at the bachelor's level.

### Second:
The Ministry shall bear the payment of all tuition fees resulting from the student's enrollment in the educational institution in accordance with the provisions of these regulations, and shall bear the bank commission expenses resulting from the transfer of financial entitlements to students studying abroad.

### Third:
A continuing student's right to receive the monthly allowance shall not be forfeited during the occurrence of force majeure events that prevent him from arriving in the country of dispatch on the scheduled date and are approved by the Ministry, provided that his delay in arrival does not exceed thirty days. If it exceeds this period, his right to payment for the period of delay shall be forfeited, and payment shall resume from the date of his arrival in the country of dispatch.

### Fourth:
The prescribed monthly allowances may be disbursed to the student during a medical leave granted once during the entire period of study, provided it does not exceed one academic semester or its equivalent in the annual system. Disbursement may also be permitted for a second time only in critical and incurable medical cases that require hospitalization, provided the conditions stated in clause First of Article (23) of the regulations are met.
<page_end>59</page_end>

**Fifth:** The prescribed financial allowances shall continue to be disbursed to a female student who requests maternity leave during her studies for a period of three months only, and for one time only during the period of study.

**Sixth:** The student's right to claim allowances or benefits shall be forfeited after one year from the date of entitlement.

**Seventh:** The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> is not entitled to suspend the monthly allowances for any reason whatsoever, except after the student has been officially notified by the Cultural Office for a period of no less than one month prior to the suspension.

**Eighth:** If the student does not complete the required units and does not register during the summer period to complete them, the full value of the summer months' allowances shall be recovered from him, starting from the beginning of the following academic year, at a rate of (25%) per month until the entire debt is settled.

**Ninth:** If a student studying under the annual system does not successfully complete the academic year, the full value of the summer months' allowances shall be recovered from him, and shall be deducted from the allowances of the months of the following academic year at a rate of (25%) per month until the entire debt is settled.

**Tenth:** If the student withdraws from some academic units after the end of the add/drop period at the educational institutions in which he registered after paying their fees, the Cultural Office shall recover from him what was paid for these units in monthly installments at a rate of (25%) of the total monthly allowance until the entire debt is settled.

**Eleventh:** In the event of a student's absence without an acceptable excuse for a period exceeding (20%) of his prescribed attendance rate in all stages (preparatory - academic), or an absence exceeding (14) consecutive days in a semester under various academic systems, the value of the days of absence shall be deducted from his monthly allowances at a deduction rate not exceeding (25%) until the entire debt is settled. Official holidays in the country of dispatch are excluded from this.

**Twelfth:** Monthly allowances shall be deducted from the student in the event of successive academic and disciplinary warnings as follows:
1- First warning: A deduction of (15%) from one monthly allowance only.
2- Second warning: A deduction of (20%) from one monthly allowance only.
3- Third and fourth warnings: A deduction of (25%) from the monthly allowance for one time only.

**Thirteenth:** The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall not bear the fees for a non-traditional course if the student does not comply with the conditions stipulated in clause number (9) of Article (5).

## Article (26)
Financial Entitlements for Companions of Scholarship and Grant Students
A dispatched student is entitled to the following for his companions in the country of dispatch:
1- A social allowance, if it is proven that the wife/husband does not have a scholarship or grant, or is not an employee under any employment system. The right to receive the social allowance is forfeited if the husband/wife is compelled to leave the country of dispatch for a period exceeding two months during the academic year, whether consecutive or separate, in accordance with the organization's decisions.
2- A children's allowance for each child, up to a maximum of three children, in accordance with the organizing decisions.
3- The prescribed financial allowances for the wife of the dispatched student who requests maternity leave during the husband's period of study shall continue to be disbursed, provided that it does not exceed three months and for one time only.

## Article (27)
Travel Tickets

### First: Travel Tickets for Scholarship and Grant Students:
1- A new student is entitled to an allowance for a one-way economy class travel ticket to join the country of dispatch, which is disbursed before the start of studies.
2- A student is entitled to be disbursed an allowance for a round-trip travel ticket and a cash allowance for a maximum of three days if the university to which the student is dispatched requires a personal interview or admission tests for the academic stage.
3- A continuing student is entitled to the annual travel ticket allowance upon meeting the required conditions for success according to each academic system, and his right to claim it is forfeited after one year from the date of entitlement.
4- A transfer student is entitled to a dispatch ticket allowance from the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to the new country of dispatch, provided that six months have passed since the entitlement date of the last travel ticket allowance.
5- A student is entitled to be disbursed a travel ticket allowance for himself and his companions in the event of the death of a first-degree relative.
6- Upon graduation, a student is entitled to a final return ticket allowance.
7- A student who has been dismissed or whose scholarship or grant has been frozen is not entitled to a travel ticket to return to the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
8- A student residing in the donor country is not entitled to travel tickets to join the country of dispatch.

### Second: Travel Tickets for the Student's Companions:
1- The companion (husband/wife) is entitled to a one-way travel ticket allowance upon joining the country of dispatch.
2- The husband/wife and up to three accompanying children are entitled to an annual travel ticket allowance if the student is entitled to such tickets.
3- Companions are entitled to a travel ticket allowance in the event of the student's death.
4- The companion is not entitled to be disbursed the annual ticket allowance before six months have passed since the disbursement of the joining ticket allowance.

### Third: The student's right to claim travel tickets for his companions is forfeited after one year from the date of entitlement.

# Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>
## (Ministerial Resolution No. 1257 of 2025)
### Regarding: Amending certain provisions of Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 concerning the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments

The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior <orig>النائب الأول لرئيس مجلس الوزراء ووزير الداخلية</orig>
- Having reviewed Decree-Law No. 67/1976 concerning Traffic and its amendments.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 concerning the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments.
- And upon the letter of the Assistant Undersecretary for Traffic and Operations Affairs <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد لشئون المرور والعمليات</orig> No. 166518 dated 21/5/2025 and its attachment.
- And based on the proposal of the Acting Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة بالتكليف</orig>.

## Has Decided
### (Article One)
Clause No. (1) of Article (85) of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 shall be amended to read as follows:
1- Private Driving License:
Issued for driving private cars that do not exceed (7) passengers, transport vehicles with a load not exceeding (2) tons, taxis, and ambulances.
It is valid for Kuwaitis and citizens of Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries for a period of (15) years.
For non-Kuwaitis, it is for a period of (5) years.
For illegal residents, the validity is according to the duration of their review card.

### (Article Two)
The Acting Undersecretary <orig>وكيل الوزارة بالتكليف</orig> shall implement this resolution, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Issued on: 22 Muharram 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 17 July 2025 AD

## Article (28)
### Education Expenses for Accompanying Persons
1- The Ministry shall bear the education expenses of the accompanying person (wife/husband) only, excluding additional expenses, provided that the education does not exceed the first university degree level, and that he/she does not already hold a first university degree certificate, for a period not exceeding the dispatched student's period of study. This also applies to children starting from the kindergarten stage and at an age of not less than four years.
2- The student's obligations as stated in Article (4) shall apply to the accompanying person.
3- In the event of the student's dismissal, the accompanying person's right to claim tuition fees shall be forfeited.

## Article (29)
### Healthcare Expenses
The Ministry shall provide health insurance for the insured person and their accompanying persons in accordance with the Health Insurance Regulations for Students, Scientific Researchers, and Field Training Students outside the State of Kuwait and its amendments.

## Article (30)
### Regulations for Financial Claims from Scholarship and Grant Students
First: 50% of all amounts disbursed to the student shall be recovered in the following cases:
1- Dismissal of the dispatched student in accordance with the cases mentioned in Article (12) of the regulations.
2- Withdrawal of the dispatched student in accordance with Article (14) of the regulations.
3- Dismissal or withdrawal of the student from the Master's degree stage.
- The student and their guardian may request a suspension of the indebtedness <orig>المديونية</orig> within one year from the date of the dismissal or withdrawal decision, upon providing proof of the student's continuation of studies.
- The indebtedness <orig>المديونية</orig> shall be reduced by 50% in the following two cases:
1- The dispatched student obtains a diploma degree within a period not exceeding 3 years from the date of the dismissal or withdrawal decision, taking into account the period of indebtedness suspension.
2- The dispatched student obtains a second university degree (Master's) in the same specialization for which they were dispatched, within a period not exceeding one year from the date of the dismissal or withdrawal decision, taking into account the period of indebtedness suspension.

Second: The student shall be exempted from the indebtedness <orig>المديونية</orig> in the following two cases:
1- Issuance of a decision to reinstate the student, taking into account the period of indebtedness suspension.
2- The dispatched student obtains a first university degree (Bachelor's) within a period not exceeding 4 years from the date of the dismissal or withdrawal decision, taking into account the period of indebtedness suspension.

Third: The amounts disbursed to the student shall not be recovered in the following two cases:
1- The student's death.
2- Physical or mental disability that prevents the student from continuing their studies, according to reports approved by the competent authorities in the State of Kuwait.

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (176) of 2025
### Concerning the Amendment of the Regulation for Organizing Cooperative Work Issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (46/T) of 2021
The Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs:
- After reviewing Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 concerning Cooperative Societies, as amended by Law No. (118) of 2013 and its amendments.
- And Decree No. (50) of 2017 concerning the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (165/T) of 2013 concerning the Executive Regulation of Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 concerning Cooperative Societies, as amended by Law No. (118) of 2013 and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (46/T) of 2021 concerning the issuance of the Regulation for Organizing Cooperative Work and its amendments.
- And upon the presentation of the Undersecretary of the Ministry.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

(( Has Decided ))

### Article One
The text of the second paragraph of Article (9) of the Regulation for Organizing Cooperative Work issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (46/T) of 2021 shall be replaced with the following text:
Article (9) Second Paragraph
Notwithstanding the provisions of this article, in emergency cases and provided that the contract value is less than KWD 7,500 (seven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), the Board of Directors may carry out works related to (electricity, air conditioning, refrigerators, firefighting, shelving, shopping carts, and linking the monitoring systems of cooperative societies with government entities). It is not permissible to divide any of these works into multiple contracts, and the Board of Directors must notify the Facilities Department of these works.

### Article Two
Any provision that contradicts the provisions of this resolution shall be repealed.

### Article Three
This resolution shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette. The competent authorities shall implement its provisions.

Minister of Social Affairs
and Family and Childhood Affairs
Dr. Amthal Hadi Haif Al-Huwailah <orig>د. أمثال هادي هايف الحويلة</orig>

Issued on: 21 Muharram 1447 H
Corresponding to: 16 July 2025 AD

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (132) of 2025
### Concerning the Registration of Al-Mowazi Capital Company in the Special Register for Securities-Based Financial Technology Services with the Capital Markets Authority as a Securities-Based Crowdfunding Platform

After reviewing:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and Regulation of Securities Activities, and its Executive Bylaws and their amendments;
- And Resolution No. (181) of 2023 regarding the launch of the initial application phase of Book Nineteen (Financial Technology) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and Regulation of Securities Activities and their amendments, issued on 28/12/2023;
- And the application of Al-Mowazi Capital Company <orig>شركة الموازي كابيتال</orig> for registration in the Special Register for Securities-Based Financial Technology Services with the Capital Markets Authority as a Securities-Based Crowdfunding Platform;
- And the schedule of final approval authorities for certain procedures of the Financial Technology Unit, approved by the resolution of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority in its meeting No. (39) of 2023, held on 27/12/2023;

Has decided the following:

### Article One
Al-Mowazi Capital Company <orig>شركة الموازي كابيتال</orig> shall be registered in the Special Register for Securities-Based Financial Technology Services with the Capital Markets Authority as a Securities-Based Crowdfunding Platform.

### Article Two
The registration period for the aforementioned company in the Special Register for Securities-Based Financial Technology Services with the Capital Markets Authority as a Securities-Based Crowdfunding Platform shall be three years, renewable, starting from the date of issuance of the registration resolution.

### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

Issued on: 20 July 2025 AD

# Resolution No. (134) of 2025
## Regarding the cancellation of the license and liquidation of the Cap Corp Local Fund

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- And the resolution of the unitholders' assembly of the Cap Corp Local Fund, held on 30/06/2025, approving the appointment of Al Safat Investment Company <orig>شركة الصفاة للاستثمار</orig> as the liquidator of the fund;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has decided the following:
### Article One
To cancel the license of the Cap Corp Local Fund, managed by Al Safat Investment Company <orig>شركة الصفاة للاستثمار</orig>, with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.

### Article Two
To appoint Al Safat Investment Company <orig>شركة الصفاة للاستثمار</orig> as the liquidator of the fund. The liquidator shall not commence its duties until after this resolution is publicized.

### Article Three
To de-register the Cap Corp Local Fund from the register of funds at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> upon completion of the liquidation procedures.

### Article Four
The fund manager shall fulfill all legal obligations stipulated under Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities and its executive regulations and their amendments, for the period prior to the effective date of this resolution.

### Article Five
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

# Decision No. (140) of 2025 regarding the registration of Ms. Munira Abdullatif Abdullah Al-Majed in the Special Register of Auditors

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- The request of Ms. Munira Abdullatif Abdullah Al-Majed <orig>منيرة عبداللطيف عبدالله الماجد</orig> regarding her registration as an auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> in the Special Register of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

## The following has been decided
### Article One
Ms. Munira Abdullatif Abdullah Al-Majed <orig>منيرة عبد اللطيف عبدالله الماجد</orig> shall be registered as an auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> in the Special Register of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.

### Article Two
The registration period for the aforementioned auditor shall be three years, commencing from the date of issuance of the registration certificate, after payment of the prescribed fees.
The aforementioned auditor is obligated to pay the fee upon renewal of the registration for any other period in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 7 of 2010, its executive regulations and their amendments, and the decisions and instructions of the Authority.

### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its own jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

**Has decided the following:**

## Decision No. 147/1 - R / 2025

Having reviewed Articles (21) and (61) of Law No. (32) of 1968 concerning Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amendments.

The following amendments to the data of the Industrial Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الصناعي</orig> shall be noted in the Register of Banks at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>:
1- Increase of the statutory reserve from 47,264,755 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to 50,136,702 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

# Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>

## Ministerial Resolution No. [19] of 2025 Amending Some Provisions of the Housing Welfare Regulation

**The Minister of State for Housing Affairs <orig>وزير الدولة لشئون الإسكان</orig>:**
- After reviewing Law No. (47) of 1993 regarding housing welfare and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (27) of 1995 regarding the contribution of the private sector in the development of state-owned vacant lands for housing welfare purposes and its amending laws,
- And the Housing Welfare Regulation issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (31) of 2016 and its amendments,
- And based on the approval of the Authority's Board of Directors in its meeting No. (2025/01-2026) held on 14/05/2025.

**It is decided**

## Article One

The texts of clauses (2, 3) of Article (99) of the aforementioned Housing Welfare Regulation shall be replaced with the following two texts:
2 - Enabling his family members to benefit from the residence, except for the non-Kuwaiti son of a Kuwaiti mother if he reaches the age of twenty-six, in which case he is prohibited from benefiting from the residence, unless he has a severe or moderate disability, or is an only son.
3 - Not leaving the residence unused, without an excuse acceptable to the Authority, for a continuous period of sixty days or a non-continuous period of ninety days within twelve months.

## Article Two

This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of publication, and the competent authorities shall implement it.

**Minister of State for Municipal Affairs and Minister of State for Housing Affairs**
**Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>**

k) only twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, non-refundable. Bids shall be submitted to the Procurement Department – Ground Floor – Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Soor Street, in sealed envelopes, accompanied by a preliminary deposit of not less than 2% and not exceeding 5% of the bid value, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee issued by a local bank in the State of Kuwait in favor of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid's validity for a period of (90 days). The envelope must be sealed with red wax and have the auction number written on the outside as indicated above, while avoiding mentioning the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 14/8/2025.
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Tuesday, 5/8/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of the Director of the General Services Department <orig>مدير إدارة الخدمات العامة</orig> in Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>الشويخ الصناعية</orig>, Plot 1, Street 14, General Services Department of the Ministry of Information <orig>إدارة الخدمات العامة التابعة لوزارة الإعلام</orig>, to answer inquiries regarding the auction. Anyone who has purchased the auction documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything recorded in the minutes of the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the auction documents and shall be binding on the bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their responses after approval to all bidders before the bid closing date.
- The aforementioned cash consideration shall be paid via K-Net card.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must adhere to submitting them to the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> at the time and place specified for the preliminary meeting.
- The bid must be submitted in a single sealed envelope containing all documents, filled out, signed, and stamped by the bidder.
- All documents must be submitted on three (3) non-copyable CDs, with the exception of the bid form and the preliminary deposit, which are to be submitted as hard copies.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees prescribed for purchasing the documents.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to participate in the auction must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.

# Ministerial Decision No. (197) of 2024
## Regarding the Appointment of a Temporary Board of Directors for the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>
The Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية وشئون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>:
* Having reviewed Law No. 24 of 1962 concerning Clubs and Public Benefit Associations and its amending laws.
* And Decree No. (50) of 2017 concerning the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
* And Ministerial Decision No. (38) of 1966 regarding the official registration of the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>.
* And Ministerial Decision (61) of 2005 regarding the model articles of association for public benefit associations.
* And Ministerial Decision No. (112) of 2009 amending the articles of association of the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>.
* And Ministerial Decision No. (46/A) of 2020 regarding the mechanism and controls for supervising the work of public benefit associations and charitable organizations.
* And whereas the term of the Board of Directors of the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig> has expired.
* And based on the requirements of the public interest.

### Article (1)
A temporary Board of Directors for the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig> is appointed for a renewable term of one year, chaired by Mr. Khaled Mohammed Sulaiman Mohammed Al-Mughamis <orig>خالد محمد سليمان محمد المغامس</orig>, with the membership of:
1- Hamoud Hamad Ali Al-Sane <orig>حمود حمد علي الصانع</orig>.
2- Yousef Abdullah Abdulaziz Yousef Abdulrahman Al-Zain <orig>يوسف عبد الله عبد العزيز يوسف عبد الرحمن الزين</orig>.
3- Fahad Ahmed Al-Mandeel <orig>فهد أحمد المنديل</orig>.
4- Saud Abdulrahman Saud Al-Mekhaizeem <orig>سعود عبد الرحمن سعود المخيزيم</orig>.

### Article (2)
The previous Board of Directors of the Society, whose term has expired, must hand over the headquarters, funds, and all documents and papers related to the Society to the temporary Board of Directors, by virtue of official records, within three days from the date of issuance of this decision.

### Article (3)
The temporary Board of Directors shall assume all the powers and authorities of the Board of Directors as stipulated in the aforementioned Law No. 21 of 1962 and the Society's articles of association.

### Article (4)
The temporary Board of Directors shall examine the Society's budget, conduct a documentary review of the Society's books and records, verify the existence of any violations, and take necessary actions in their regard to ensure the preservation of the Society's funds.

### Article (5)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into effect from the date of its issuance.
Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية وشئون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>
Dr. Amthal Hadi Al-Huwailah <orig>د. أمثال هادي الحويلة</orig>
Issued on: 25 Rabi' al-Awwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 28 September 2024 G

## Announcement
The Internal Purchasing Committee at the Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> - a subsidiary of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> - announces the issuance of Tender No.: RFQ/1058167
- MAB-DC - TO PROCURE PIPING COMPONENTS FOR U-112 AMR - 112 - 3086 / 3080 / 2107 / 2117 / 1106 / 1107 / 1934 / 2106 / 2112
This is in accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the tender documents. These documents can be obtained by visiting the unified commercial e-platform on the website of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> (K-Tendering portal) and its subsidiaries: ((https://ktendering.com.kw))

</table>

- The deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 7/8/2025, at exactly 1:00 PM local time in the State of Kuwait (13:00 Noon) with the bid.

Note that the bid must be submitted through the commercial e-platform indicated above.
- The bidder must submit the initial deposit in favor of the Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> in an envelope bearing the name and address of the tender and the closing date. It must be placed in the designated box located on the first floor, reception hall, at the Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> main office building in Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig>, no later than 1:00 PM (13:00 Noon) on Thursday, 7/8/2025, with a copy of the initial deposit attached to the bid.
- It should be noted that this is a general, non-divisible tender, and supply must be from the qualification list mentioned in the tender documents.
- A single person or a group of persons collectively may not register for classification under more than one name, nor submit more than one bid in a tender, with the exception of alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission.
- As for a person who has a share in separate companies, where each company is independent in its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative structure, they may, upon classification, register themselves and each of their independent companies.
- A bidder's bid that violates this article shall be considered null and void by law, in accordance with Article (29) of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders.

# Kuwait Real Estate Company K.P.S.C.
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Monday, July 14, 2025, at 11:00 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Kuwait Real Estate Company K.P.S.C. <orig>شركة عقارات الكويت ش.م.ك عامة</orig> was held at the company's headquarters located in the Souk Al-Kuwait building, Block (B), 8th Floor, Meeting Hall, in the presence of:
- Mr. Ibrahim Saleh Al-Tharban <orig>إبراهيم صالح الذربان</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors (Chairman of the Meeting)
Shareholders representing 795,630,809 shares of the capital, which amounts to 1,064,459,379 shares, attended, with an attendance rate of 77.295% after excluding treasury shares and neutral shares.
The secretarial duties of the meeting session were undertaken by Mrs. Amal Al-Ashab <orig>آمال الأصهب</orig> – Secretary of the Board of Directors.
After the Chairman of the Meeting announced that the legal quorum for holding the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was complete, the Assembly began discussing the agenda items, which resulted in the following resolutions:
First Item: Approval of Capital Increase
Approval was granted by a majority of the attendees to increase the company's authorized capital by 15% through a cash increase from KWD 106,445,937.900 (one hundred six million, four hundred forty-five thousand, nine hundred thirty-seven Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and nine hundred fils) to KWD 122,412,828.500 (one hundred twenty-two million, four hundred twelve thousand, eight hundred twenty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 500 fils), distributed over 1,224,128,285 cash shares with a nominal value of 100 fils per share, subject to the approval of the competent authorities. The Board of Directors was also authorized to complete all procedures related to the company's capital increase, including noting the increase in the issued and paid-up capital in the Commercial Register, by a resolution from the Board specifying the amount and methods of the increase and all its terms and conditions, as well as the share premium and its value to be added to the nominal value of the new shares. The Board is also authorized to determine, amend, or delegate whom it deems appropriate to determine or amend the dates for the subscription, trading, eligibility, and distribution periods related to the company's capital increase and to take all necessary actions. The company's shareholders registered in the company's records at the end of the eligibility day and the holders of priority rights shall have priority in subscribing to the cash increase, each according to their share in the company's capital, for a period of not less than fifteen (15) days from the date of opening the subscription. Thereafter, the Board of Directors may extend the period for exercising priority rights and allocate the surplus of unsubscribed shares to current or new shareholders in accordance with the provisions of the law.

The meeting was also attended by:
- Ms. Shahad Badr Al-Din Ahmed <orig>شهد بدر الدين أحمد</orig> – in her capacity as Secretary of the Board of Directors.
- Shareholders owning and representing 69,288,194 shares, in person and by proxy, equivalent to a percentage of 86.61% of the company's total capital shares, which amount to 80,000,000 shares.

After confirming the availability of the legal quorum required for the validity of the company's Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the meeting, Mr. Hassan Khaled Jafar Al-Sayegh <orig>حسن خالد جعفر الصايغ</orig>, welcomed the attendees. He then announced the calculated legal quorum, stating the attendance of shareholders owning and representing 86.61% of the company's total capital shares. He then proceeded to present the item on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly, and the following was resolved:
- The amendment of the text of Article (2) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (1) of the Articles of Association was approved and ratified by amending the company's trade name to become as follows:
  - Text of the article before amendment:
  The company's name is: Flex Real Estate and Health Clubs Company – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>.
  - Text of the article after amendment:
  The company's name is: Aknan National Real Estate and Health Clubs Company <orig>شركة أكنان الوطنية العقارية والأندية الصحية</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>.

At the end of the meeting, Mr. Hassan Khaled Jafar Al-Sayegh <orig>حسن خالد جعفر الصايغ</orig>, the Chairman of the meeting, thanked all the attendees. He then adjourned the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, which concluded at 1:30 PM on the same day.

# Ministry of Education
## Announcement
Regarding Tender No. (M K / 119 / 2025-2026 AD) Part 1 for the printing and supply of schoolbooks – Requirement of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector

The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the issuance of a (limited) tender for the printing and supply of schoolbooks for the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the technical conditions and specifications contained in the tender documents.

**General Guidelines for the Tender:**
1- The tender is (limited) to bidders accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of this announcement.
3- Applicants for this tender must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the current year, and must attach a certificate to that effect with their bid, dated concurrently with the tender issuance date.
4- This tender is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents state otherwise.
5- The fee for obtaining a copy of the tender documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary deposit of not less than (2000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> of the bid value. This deposit must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and must not be subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this deposit, or accompanied by a deposit that violates any of the aforementioned regulations, will be disregarded. The deposit must be valid for the required duration of the bid's validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the tender works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
8- The bidder agrees that their bid shall remain valid and in effect, irrevocable, and may not be withdrawn from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid has been submitted.
9- If, upon studying the tender, the bidder finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect the bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
10- Tender documents must be deposited in the bid box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in the South Subhan area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), in accordance with the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding any change or extension of the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted bids be considered after the bid has been submitted.
11- The bidder must fill out the attached tables and provide a statement of all supplies necessary for the execution of the works subject of the tender (if any) within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry has the right to reject a bid if it does not include the completed tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the tender.
12- The bidder must submit all bank guarantees related to this tender in the Arabic language.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education

# Ministry of Interior
## Announcement
The General Directorate of Nationality and Travel Documents <orig>الإدارة العامة للجنسية ووثائق السفر</orig> announces that the persons whose names are listed below have reported the loss of their Kuwaiti nationality certificates. Anyone who finds any of these certificates is requested to hand them over to the Directorate within two weeks from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette. Otherwise, these individuals will be issued new Kuwaiti nationality certificates in accordance with the established procedures.

# Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces Tender No. S/M/5/2024/2025 for the renewal of licenses and maintenance of devices (Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>) for the Blood Bank Center - Al-Adan Hospital <orig>مستشفى العدان</orig>, open to companies specialized in this field and registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>, in accordance with the general and special conditions specified in the tender documents. 1- The local company must be registered in the supplier registry of the Medical Warehouses Department.
2- The local company must specialize in the medical field, documented by a certified certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
3- When submitting two offers, two separate tender booklets must be purchased with two different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Botanical Drugs, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and the product's registration in the supplier registry of the Medical Warehouses Department, within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to the Drug Control Department).
5- Provide samples of new materials, whether it is a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, to the relevant control department (Pharmaceuticals – Medical Supplies).
6- Attach a national labor support percentage certificate.
7- Tender documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's website.
8- The fee for purchasing the tender booklet can be paid through the website to be attached with the tender documents.
9- Price quotations must be submitted in a sealed envelope along with the tender documents by the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's website.

# Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting Held on 06/07/2025
After reviewing the applications submitted for the amendment of data in the births and deaths records, it was decided to make the amendments listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee receives no objection within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued in accordance with the following amendment:

# Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting Held on 18/06/2025
The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36 of 1969 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, convened.
- The Doctor / Chairman of the General Medical Council (Chairman)
- Mr. / Head of the Registration Department (Member)
- Mr. / Head of the Deaths Department (Member)
- Mr. / The Legal Researcher (Member)

The secretarial duties of the Committee were performed by Mrs. Aliaa Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig>.
The Committee reviewed applications from No. ((235)) to No. ((247)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the births and deaths records for requests of late registration of birth and death, amendments, and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement expires without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued. The Committee, after its review and verification of the completion of documents and records, has decided to announce the amendments.

# Record of Announcement of Sale of Seized Items

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Capital Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ العاصمة</orig> – Compulsory Execution Section <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> – announces that on Wednesday, 13/8/2025, the movables of the judgment debtor, KCC Engineering and Contracting Company (K.S.C.) Closed <orig>شركة كي سي سي للهندسة والمقاولات (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>, will be sold by public auction. These items are detailed in the executive seizure report dated 18/5/2025, which were seized for the benefit of Moudhi Ali Salem Al-Sabah <orig>موضي علي سالم الصباح</orig>, in execution of judgment No. 7472/2024. The sale will take place at the address located in the Shuaiba Industrial Area - West <orig>شعبة الصناعية الغربية</orig> – Plot (11) – Block (11) – PACI No. (96245001), in settlement of the amount of (1,315,710 K.D. <orig>د. ك</orig>).

If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days. Those wishing to purchase must be present at the time and place specified above. For more information, the Compulsory Execution Section <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> may be contacted during official working hours. This is announced for public information.

Head of the Capital Execution Department <orig>رئيس إدارة تنفيذ العاصمة</orig>
